description:
Mercuria specializes in trading and supplying physical commodities, investing in strategic assets, providing financing and logistics services and offering solutions to help clients meet their needs, including their net-zero goals.

We have built a strong reputation with our unwavering focus on compliance and rigorous approach to risk management, and we are now regarded as one of the largest privately-owned businesses of our type in the world.

Over the years, we have grown organically through hiring and development of best-in-class talent, and strategically with the acquisitions of the trading unit of JPMorgan Chase & Company, Noble Group’s US gas and power business, and the Aegean Marine Petroleum Network, reorganized as our wholly owned bunkering and maritime subsidiary, Minerva Bunkering.

In recent years, we have made a strategic shift towards advancing the energy transition to more sustainable energy, and have invested in a range of projects from renewables and biofuels, to technology metals and electric vehicle infrastructure, and environmental and carbon management products. We have also launched and support several ESG-focused initiatives, such as a program to improve the health and wellbeing of Earth’s oceans in partnership with Hub Ocean.

Today, Mercuria is one of the world's leading independent energy and commodity trading companies. Our Swiss heritage has grown to a global presence, with operations in over 50 countries on 5 continents, employ over 1100 people of more than 40 nationalities in over 30 locations and generate revenues of over $100 bn.

We remain independent and privately owned by our founders, employees and a group of strategic investors. Our co-founders, Marco Dunand and Daniel Jaeggi, have worked together for nearly 40 years. Beginning their careers together at Cargill International, they both subsequently moved to trading roles at Goldman Sachs’s J. Aron trading unit, Salomon Brothers and Sempra Energy before founding Mercuria in 2004.
name: Mercuria

Trailstone is a global energy and technology company, operating at the intersection of renewable and conventional power. We trade energy in global markets, and we provide a best-in-class service to manage the inherent intermittency of renewable power generation across the short, medium and long term.

As an energy trader, we buy and sell electricity and gas which is physically delivered on the grids, and we leverage our physical market knowledge to trade financial commodities.

As a provider of renewable energy management services, we take on the complexity of managing renewable power across different countries so that our customers can focus on their core mission of investment and growth. Trailstone offers an efficient, fully automated front-to-back renewable power management platform underpinned by our long-standing market experience, proprietary technology, data analytics and meteorology.

description:
EDF Trading is a leader in the international wholesale energy markets. We manage a portfolio of assets which give us the ability to source, supply, transport, store, blend and convert physical commodities around the world. These capabilities enable us to deliver essential asset optimisation services, risk management and wholesale market access to the EDF Group and our third-party customers, helping them to realise the value inherent in their asset portfolios.

EDF Trading is active in the electricity, natural gas, LPG, oil and environmental products markets. We are also active in the LNG and coal and freight markets via JERA Global Markets. We are one of the largest wholesale market traders in Europe for power and gas. In North America, we are one of the leading marketers of gas and power, one of the main providers of generation services for power generation companies and a leading energy retailer for large commercial and industrial customers. 

We are a 100% owned subsidiary of EDF SA., one of the world’s biggest electricity generators and a leader in low-carbon production.

EDF Trading recognises the importance of attracting, retaining and developing diverse world-class professionals. We identify, foster and reward all talent, valuing and leveraging the diversity amongst our people to offer creative and innovative products and services to the EDF Group and our third-party customers. We have a culture that enables us to be forward thinking and agile and at EDF Trading, individuals can really make a difference. Everyone shares a common vision and a team spirit that encourages people to make things happen. EDFT is about working together, embracing the challenge and delivering exceptional customer service.

With offices in London (Headquarters), Paris, Houston and Singapore, we have a cosmopolitan mix of more than 35 nationalities from our global employee base of around 800 people.

LUMENION’s core team is supported by an internationally experienced board and partners with a successful track record in the development, marketing, and implementation of competitive renewable energy solutions.

The material is made to customers’ exacting specifications for tires, coatings, batteries, plastics and numerous other specialty, high-performance applications. Carbon black not only tints and colorizes, it provides reinforcement, conducts electricity, increases durability and adds UV protection. A global company, Orion has innovation centers on three continents and 14 plants worldwide, offering the most production processes in the industry. The company’s corporate lineage stretches back more than 160 years to Germany, where it operates the world’s longest-running carbon black plant. description:
At Hudson River Trading (HRT) we are mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and engineers. We research and develop automated trading algorithms using advanced mathematical techniques. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments, and our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

HRT’s founding partners graduated from Harvard and MIT with degrees in computer science and mathematics, and founded HRT in 2002. Armed with programming skills and sharp quantitative minds, the founders hypothesized that by applying a fresh take to trading stocks, one that truly leverages the power of technology, they could meaningfully impact a world still dominated by manual operators. Very quickly, their algorithms saw success in the markets and HRT grew from their origins in US equities to a global, multi-asset class trading firm.

Today HRT employs over 800 brilliant minds from a variety of disciplines—from highly technical to deeply mathematical to the liberal arts. We are critical thinkers and eager automators, chasing new solutions to any problem we encounter.

We trade on nearly all of the world’s electronic markets, and are a leading voice for fair and open markets. Our internal code of ethics far exceeds the expectations of the regulatory environment in which we operate. We are conscientious market participants advocating for fair and transparent markets for everyone. This philosophy influences every aspect of our research.

Please be aware that HRT emails will always come from the @hudson-trading.com domain; a genuine offer document will not be signed by a recruiter; and HRT will never request your personal banking information or payment of any kind during the recruitment process. If you have received what you suspect is a fraudulent offer or suspicious communication with HRT, or if you have any questions, please reach out to security@hudson-trading.com.
name: Hudson River Trading

description:
Buchu Trading is established in 2015 as the sole distributor/importer for Cape Moondance Buchu in Europe. 

Buchu is a herb endemic to the Western Cape in South Africa. The herbs holds a number of qualities which a beneficial for the health.

Buchu helps to aid or prevent infections to the urinary system like urethritis, cystitis and prostatitis. Buchu is  a natural anti-inflammatory and antiseptic and can assist with the prevention of cystitis (bladder infection), prostate and kidney problems and it helps with incontinence associated with prostate problems. Buchu leaves offer natural relief from menstrual problems such as cramps and bloating.

In 2016 Buchu Trading acquired Sceletia and became the European distributor for this South African herbal tea as well.

Sceletia is a rare combination which combines the pleasant taste and aroma and health benefits of Honeybush with the powerful natural remedy for stress and anxiety, Sceletium.

Honeybush, so named in recognition of its honey-scented flowers and the subtle overtones of honey in the fragrance and flavour of the tea derived from it.

Sceletium is a succulent occurring naturally in the Karoo and Namaqualand,  used for centuries by the Khoi and San and is known for its calming and mood-elevating properties.

In 2017 Buchu Trading, realizing and knowing that life and environment are precious, focused on organic products. This was found in becoming agent and distributor for Skimmelberg Buchu and Rooibos. A beautiful company, farming at a close to bio-dynamical way. Next to Skimmelberg we started to represent Cape Kingdom Nutraceuticals. Instead of trading Buchu tea, we started representing Buchu and it's health benefits.

Our organic adventure continues by becoming the agent for Soil organic essential oils in the Netherlands and Germany and distributeur for Italy. Again a company focused on environment, it's people and  health.
name: Buchu Trading

description:
Tony's Coffee is an independently-owned, fair trade pioneer. Their mission is to produce coffee that is a force for good. 

They're the 2021 Roaster of the Year, awarded by Roast Magazine. 

In 2002, they became one of the country’s first coffee roasters to source organic, fair trade, shade grown coffee from farmer-owned cooperatives.

In 2012, they became a founding member of World Coffee Research, whose work help ensures the future of sustainable coffee production.

In 2013, they won the America’s Best Espresso Award and the following year they took home 1st place at the Specialty Coffee Association’s Roasters Choice competition. 

In 2018, they passed $1,000,000 in social premiums paid out to fair trade coffee cooperatives around the world. These funds have helped build schools, roads, and clean water projects. 


In 2019, they installed a high efficiency, American-built Loring Roaster. This new technology helped reduce the carbon footprint of their roastery by over 50%. 

In 2020, they converted their roastery and delivery fleet to become 100% carbon neutral. They've pledged to become historically carbon neutral by the year 2030.
name: Tony's Coffee

As a result of its coffee’s richness in taste and quality, Café Abi Nasr has grown to reach a production capacity of 1.5 tons/hour supplying different markets (shops, supermarkets, restaurants, …) and along with this expansion, Café Abi Nasr strived to develop novel coffee products made from fresh recipes and created new brands to meet the market’s needs such as its new Lebanese coffee product branded “Morena Café”, its exquisite espresso “Prestigio”, and the most wanted filter coffee “Western Cup”.

This success is the ultimate result of the company’s commitment to its customer satisfaction and preferences and its constant innovation based on the market trends without neglecting our superb touch of traditional know-how.
name: Café Abi Nasr

description:
We offer Superlost as the spark to ignite creativity. We are committed to creating a world where livelihoods are supported and uplifted, which is why we go beyond fair in compensating our partner coffee producers and artists. Join us in the pursuit of excellence, one sip at a time.

It starts with TRACEABILITY.


The reason wine producers are synonymous with wealth, and coffee farmers with poverty, is due to transparency or lack thereof. Our goal as a company is to get more people to care about where the coffee they're drinking came from. We accomplish this by providing that information, which can be confusing to anyone not familiar with it, via cool artwork and approachable data.

Here's the secret to finding good coffee: the more information you know about the coffee, the higher the quality. That's it. That's the whole formula. Think about how often you'll just drink some coffee and have ZERO idea about where in the world that came from. Oh it's a blend? A blend of what? The reason that information is not normally provided is simple. The less you know about the origin, the less they have to pay the people who produce it.

We call our coffee Beyond Fair because as a company we are committed to always pay above fair trade minimum prices to coffee producers. We don't think they pay high enough so we do. Speaking of paying human beings a liveable wage: we pay all Superlost Partner Artists above market rates because exposure doesn’t pay artists, money does. Each Partner Artist drinks the coffee they're representing, and then they illustrate whatever it inspires in them.

So now it's your turn. Have a cup of Superlost, and see what it inspires in you!

DRINK CREATIVELY
name: Superlost Coffee

description:
We work with coffee producers in Brazil and Guatemala. 

Creating quality by increasing productivity at farm level and establishing long term relationships. This work consists in identifying the key elements unique to each coffee producing area to maximize the flavor and productivity potential. 

Our team then proceeds to implement programs that will help the producers have a better understanding of their growing conditions and processing methods. 

These programs are based in the interaction people have with plants and soil in order to build a balanced and healthy environment. Results are measured in our ability to replicate quality year after year and sustain long term relationships with coffee roasters around the world.

Ally Coffee is a green coffee company connecting roasters with specialty coffees sourced through sustainable partnerships with a purpose to open up opportunities that move coffee forward. 

Our  founders have roots in Brazil, where their experience growing, exporting, and roasting coffee inspired them to integrate the supply chain. Our team is made up of individuals with varied backgrounds and expertise in coffee, empowering us to build an open community around inspiration, knowledge, and guidance. With offices and representatives located in the United States, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ethiopia, Europe, United Kingdom, and the Middle East, we work with a diverse range of producers and roasters across the globe. 

Our ambition is to continue to build Ally on foundations of shared value and mutual reward and make coffee a global model for business.
name: Ally Coffee

description:
Café de Monteverde was born in 1989 as an association of 12 families with deep roots in coffee, agriculture, conservation, and education. For over four generations, our families have grown, processed and roasted the best quality coffee in the Monteverde Region, striving for harmony with the surrounding cloud forest.

Coffee culture was first brought to Monteverde in the early 1930s by families from Costa Rica’s central valley. As descendants of that group of pioneers, we have treasured their legacy for years so we can share it with you today. Today, we cover coffee production all the way from seed germination to ripe cherries, to processing as sun-dried beans, and roasting.

Our main farm is located in Cañitas, close to the Monteverde Cloud Forest, where we also roast and monitor quality in our cupping laboratory. We continue diversifying production with an organic vegetable garden, goats, pigs, and hens, and by maintaining half the land on this farm under forest cover, allowing for a balance between production and nature protection.

In 2008 we opened our LIFE Monteverde educational program on sustainable production, bringing together our passion for coffee, our experience in agriculture and education, and our appreciation for the importance of educating future generations Each year, nearly a thousand students learn from the farm’s educational resources and take back home lessons for a sustainable living.

We invite you to join one of our daily tours for an in depth coffee experience, to join a Life Monteverde program or simply enjoy a cup of coffee at the Coffee Center, in the heart of Monteverde.
name: Café Monteverde

description:
:::::: COMPAÑÍA CAFETERA LA MESETA S.A. :::::: www.lameseta.com.co/

The history of La Meseta began as small-scale coffee growers with a production of 10.000kg of coffee parchment in the town of Villamaria, State of Caldas, Colombia, and today the company has established itself as a strong agro-industrial complex with an average production of Excelso coffee (green coffee) export type of 35,000 bags per month on average.

:::::: OUR COFFEE :::::: 
Coffee of origin from certified farms whose production has complied with the Rainforest Alliance Sustainable Agriculture Standard and guarantees its origin, cultivation efficiency, good manufacturing practices, and supply chain protection. We maintain availability for the Rainforest Alliance in the qualities described below; we also sell our coffee in these qualities without the RA seal:

description:
De la Gente is a 501(c)(3) non-profit social enterprise creating economic opportunity for small-scale coffee producers in Guatemala.

We envision a coffee industry that is equitable and inclusive, that enables small-scale farmers to earn a dignified income and live prosperous lives, that facilitates authentic relationships between coffee producers and buyers, and that prioritizes economic, social and environmental needs of everyone involved.

De La Gente has four areas of work:

1. COFFEE COMMERCIALIZATION
We commercialize coffee from our partner cooperatives, providing improved market access for farmers while delivering a high quality product to roasters and consumers. DLG offers better and more stable prices to farmers.

2. COOPERATIVE ASSISTANCE
We work to build the capacity of our partner co-ops to be successful farmer-run organizations that deliver economic benefits for their members and invest in continued improvement of their individual and collective abilities. 

3. COMMUNITY TOURISM
We welcome visitors to the communities in which we work to authentically interact with and learn from coffee producers while providing an alternative income for farmers and their families.

4. AWARENESS RAISING
We seek to cultivate conscientious coffee consumers by educating our supporters about the rise of the coffee industry in Guatemala and its impact on the communities with which we work.
name: De La Gente

description:
Mercon Group is a vertically integrated global green coffee supplier. We are among the leading coffee suppliers in the world. Our trajectory of over 60 years in the business, has granted us global access to the coffee supply chain. 

We have extensive experience in farming, production, trading, marketing, logistics and risk management in the coffee industry. 

Throughout the years, we have encouraged best-practice solutions to integrate innovation and technology across our entire organization to deliver the best client experience. We are also strongly committed to the sustainability of the coffee industry to generate long-term value and benefits for everyone in the supply chain. Our purpose is to build a better coffee world. 

Mercon's headquarters are in the Netherlands. Our presence throughout the world allow us to service clients in more than 40 countries. We offer a quality product according to each of our clients specific needs. Our business model is based on a strong supply chain that adds value from the producer to the roaster. Mercon brings to our clients the world of coffee in one place. 

Our companies are in 9 countries: Brazil, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Netherlands, Panama, Spain, USA and Vietnam.
name: Mercon Coffee Group

Active sourcing, pre-selection, and logistics management are our main activities. The organization has grown into an export company that can provide specialty coffee globally.
The team maintains close relationship with the buyers the farmers and
cooperatives, keeping up with innovations that happen on farm level.

Our aim is to give coffee producers a voice, provide regular updates about producers and generate valuable content to help roasters market their coffee, handpicking lots from producers focused on specialty coffee production and also telling a little more about them and their story.

description:
FRINJ Coffee creates a transformative experience by connecting coffee drinkers to farmers, propelling the growth of a coffee industry in California. With our integrated coffee value chain that starts with an innovative coffee breeding program, grower support network, and sophisticated processing facilities, we produce exceptional quality coffees.

Ranging from Santa Barbara to north of San Diego, our farmers produce over 14 varieties of coffee, including Geisha, Laurina, Caturra Rojo, Catuai Rojo, and Pacamara. Our centralized coffee processing gives us the ability to craft unique nano and micro-lots representing the work of individual farmers, specific varieties, and innovative processing methods. We also have the capacity to produce larger community lots built around flavor profiles.

We are transforming the coffee industry, curating California grown coffee, and leading the way in sustainability, innovation, art, science, and taste. From seed to cup, our mission is to awaken care through the transformative nature of our coffee.
name: Frinj Coffee, Inc.

description:
World Coffee Research (WCR) is a 501 (c)(5) non-profit, collaborative research and development program of the global coffee industry to grow, protect, and enhance supplies of quality coffee while improving the livelihood of the families who produce it. 

WCR works to create a toolbox of coffee varieties, genetic resources and accompanying technologies and to disseminate them strategically and collaboratively in producing countries to alleviate constraints to the supply chain of high quality coffee. We have research trials and projects underway in 30+ countries, all of which are designed to deliver higher quality coffee, more productive coffee farms, and more sustainable livelihoods for coffee farmers. 

Most of our research is conducted in the places where coffee is grown. We conduct our work in partnership with leading research institutes, governmental bodies, and coffee organizations from around the world, including the Specialty Coffee Associations of America and Europe (SCAA/SCAE), the International Coffee Organization (ICO), the Coffee Quality Institute (CQI), the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT), Centre de coopération internationale en recherche agronomique pour le développement  (CIRAD), Texas A&M University and the Borlag Institute, and among others. To ensure maximum on-the-ground impact, we also partner closely with local research institutions, coffee organizations, governments, NGOs, and the private sector.

WCR's American headquarters is in Portland, OR with satellite offices in Marseille, France, and Santa Ana, El Salvador, where we also operate a research farm. WCR is funded through direct contributions from coffee industry stakeholders. Additional funding also comes from foundations, development organizations, and scientific research granting agencies. 

Twitter @WCoffeeResearch 
Facebook /worldcoffeeresearch
Instagram /wcoffeeresearch

For more information, contact info@worldcoffeeresearch.org
name: World Coffee Research

We are an origin coffee-trading company, based in Costa Rica. But more More than coffee traders, we are experts in relationships. We truly know about our coffee bean’s origins, and their destination— connecting coffee producers with roasters all around the world. We believe in innovation, transparency, and human talent.
Through our experience, we have developed unique and personalized relationships meeting each of our clients’ needs. We can help you find the most adequate solutions for your market needs and sustainability objectives. Visit our Webpage or get in touch and let us help you find your perfect coffee match.

description:
Dating back nearly 500 years, Franciscan monks were among the first to arrive in what is today known as Bolivia. They laid the foundation for the San Francisco de Asis Cathedral. At this site the city to be known as "Our Lady of Peace" (Nuestra Senora de La Paz) was born.

Found high in the Andes mountains, at 3000 meters above sea level, La Paz is the highest capital in the world today.

In keeping with the tradition of peace San Francisco Coffee serves as a bridge between cultures and provides the best that Bolivia has to offer too the world. We work directly with cooperative coffee producers to obtain the finest coffee beans available. We keep with the spirit of Fair Trade by offering the best price to these cooperative communities. We do this to help them develop long term sustainable methods to improve their communities while maintaining their rich cultural heritage.
name: San Francisco Coffee

description:
Behind every coffee we offer is a great deal of intention and investment — not just the work we do to find aligned partners in remote and underserved areas but to hone both the coffees and the relationships as close to perfection as we can get. Through developing mutually beneficial relationships with the farmers, cooperatives, and communities we buy from, we are building a stronger, more resilient supply chain. 

We are grateful to work with some of the finest coffee producers in the world — coffee producers well off the beaten path, who need a strong link to the consuming marketplace. The most important thing we do is to provide that link. We encourage farmers to produce the best coffee they possibly can and support their endeavors by paying higher premiums for higher quality while ensuring a high base price for all tiers that meet our standard. We tie prices to cupping scores so that they are consistent and transparent with a focus on the base price being sustainable.

Possibly our greatest value add is in understanding the intricacies in the middle of the supply chain, ensuring that the work farmers do arrives in your hands with its fullest potential intact, ready for you to do your best work as well. 

In that spirit, we’ve opened headquarters in Lima, Peru and Oaxaca, Mexico as well as our original HQ in Berkeley, California, allowing us to offer year-round producer support and manage collection, milling, and shipping logistics day-to-day throughout the entire season. 

With over a decade of experience trading coffee on both ends of the specialty spectrum, we’ve learned that every roasting company can need help with their menus at times. We know that our customers, whether they’re small operations without the monster budget to travel or medium-sized roasters who understand that they can’t source everything on their own, are constantly looking for consistent high quality coffees.
name: Red Fox Coffee Merchants

description: For more than 25 years, Groundwork has been a coffee and tea destination, handcrafting delicious drinks from the finest ingredients. We were one of the first certified organic coffee roasters in California and, now, a certified organic roaster in Portland. Our sustainable, relationship-based, organic coffee sourcing set an industry standard, as did our solar-powered, low-emissions roasting technology. Today, we have multiple café locations around L.A. and in Portland, and distribute our coffees and teas throughout the U.S.

description:
Since 1994, relationship has been at the core of everything we do at Uncommon Coffee Roasters. From our customers to our coffee producers, and everybody in between, we make it our priority to build strong, sustainable partnerships. 

Under the new ownership of multigenerational coffee farmers, Bruno Nobre, Mauricio DaSilva and the Uncommon team are continuing this mission of spreading love and coffee one cup at a time. 

Bruno and Mauricio come from a long line of coffee farmers in Brazil and continue to work closely with coffee producers to better understand their products. Sourcing green coffee globally and traveling to the origin whenever possible continue to be a top priority for Uncommon Coffee Roasters. 

UCR is proud to provide a variety of delicious and unique coffees and coffee products both locally and nationally while also creating and maintaining sustainable partnerships with customers, coffee producers and everyone in between. 

Celebrating diversity, giving back to the communities it serves and incorporating sustainable practices are at the heart of Uncommon Coffee Roasters’ core values. Uncommon strives to work with companies who share these same values.
name: Uncommon Coffee Roasters

description:
Family Farming and Fair Trade

We believe that family farming is one of the pillars of a strong cooperative, after all, it is through people and a family circle that respects and creates opportunities for everyone that we are able to change the reality of the environment where we are inserted for the better!
 
FairTrade, or Fair Trade in Portuguese, is a global movement that aims to give producers, workers the tools and guarantees, ranging from fair remuneration for the products and services provided, as well as practices that guarantee the well-being not only of their own, as well as his family and the entire society where the cooperative is inserted, thanks to environmental protection projects, as well as social projects.


Empowering the producer, so that he is the owner of his own destiny, without becoming dependent on third parties, throughout the production and marketing process of his products.

We at Coorpol are proud to encourage and have the FairTrade International seal, which, in addition to ensuring that the cooperative, has actions and attitudes that foster the generation of opportunities and a better life for our members, developed social and social and environmental projects, for the benefit of the entire region and society where we are located.
name: Coorpol Fairtrade - Organic Specialty Coffee

description:
George Howell Coffee was created in early 2004 to forge a new kind of partnership with coffee growers – one which recognizes their fundamental role and identity in the production of high quality coffees. We believe that one should not blend truly fine coffees, just like one does not blend fine wines, because they are already complete statements. There has been very little incentive, in terms of remuneration and acknowledgment, for producers to create really great coffees.

Our primary objective is to roast and directly serve coffee lovers with the finest coffees on earth. In that role we have pioneered technologies and relationships to coffee farmers to raise quality to new heights. We currently have three cafes in the greater Boston area (at 505 Washington Street, Downtown Crossing adjoining the Godfrey Hotel, at Boston Public Market, and  in Newtonville). We are carefully expanding to further locations. We also wholesale fine coffees in a variety of roasts for restaurants, bakeries and other fine food establishments. See www.GeorgeHowellCoffee.com for more information.

Aficionados! You have barely tasted the tip of the potential quality iceberg! Coffee growers remain locked in the commodity matrix because the coffee-roaster tradition has promoted blends as products superior to the sum of their parts – meaning the single origin coffees. So, most farmers produce what the market demands: acceptable, large coffee lots for blending. Growers of anonymous coffees-to-be-blended depend for economic sustenance on the goodwill and/or temporal strategies of the buyers’ market, from giant corporations to Fair Trade. Coffee producers, so far, are only beginning to have a market platform for high-craft self-expression.
name: George Howell Coffee Company

description:
The challenge is making a quality cup of coffee from its inception to the cup. Coffee producing countries and farmers quality of life needs to be improved thru coffee consumption in our part of the world. Coffee roasters are improving their methods of processing and cupping coffee to maintain a high quality product and in return can command a standard of living that is far beyond just sustaining livelihood.
Cognoscenti Coffee is currently working with Four Barrel Coffee, a roasting works in San Francisco, exercising direct trade with farmers and roasting coffee of the highest quality that allow for single origins to be expressed, limiting the need for blends. Their coffee is well balanced with body, clarity, and flavors that speak of the coffee terroir.
One of the greatest challenges now for coffee is changing our understanding of coffee, where it can stand alone without milk and sugar, the origins, the people involved and the optimistic direction that the coffee industry is heading that benefits both the customer and producer. The inherent characteristics of coffee don’t have to be astringent and bitter but rather the opposite full of amazing complexities that share flavor profiles as rich as wine.
name: Cognoscenti Coffee

description: We have direct ties to the producers of coffee at several single estates in Papua New Guinea. The concept and mission for Benchmark is to represent the estates’ top grades, connect roasters with production, and to act as a true sourcing partner for our relationship coffees. We bring roasters an ability to source some of Papua New Guinea’s best coffees with a level of traceability that has not previously been possible for coffees from this origin.
name: Benchmark Coffee Traders

description:
Thornton Family Coffee Roasters was founded by Paul Thornton, who started his coffee career in 1982 working for Coffee Bean International as their Roastmaster. Paul is a Specialty Coffee Association Former President, a Roasters Guild founder and longtime member, and a recognized coffee Roastmaster and green coffee buyer. 

Paul has partnered with his daughter Rachel and son-in-law Chris Verhaalen. Rachel is an expert Barista, trained extensively in coffee retail. Both Rachel and Chris lived in Kailua Kona, Hawaii, from 2012 to 2016 as coffee producers and roasters of Kona coffee. They used their skill to purchase, roast, and deliver sustainable coffee to retail shops and consumers in the area.

Our deep roots in the Portland coffee scene have helped us understand the local industry and how it compares to the rest of the Northwest. Our focus is to supply coffee of unparalleled quality and educate our wholesale and retail customers who wish to be a part of our efforts to offer an upscaled coffee experience.

We purchase green coffee through certifications, direct trade, and transparent supply chains—some of which we have been working with for years—and ship it to our roasting facility in Beaverton.

Grounded in our rich coffee history, we are continually expanding our passion within the coffee world and are excited to offer clean, fresh, solid tasting coffees. We work hard and have fun doing what we love to do most—roast coffee!
name: Thornton Family Coffee Roasters

description: Cloudland Coffee Company is a small batched coffee roaster founded in 2015 by our owner, Kristina Madh. Named after the beautiful Cloudland Canyon in our home state of Georgia, Kristina grew the business using the values important to her: Quality, Sustainability and Purpose. Why did she start this business? She loves coffee. It's as simple as that. Cloudland Coffee, started out as first as a cottage food business out of her house. About a year she moved the business to a commercial kitchen (Prep ATL) and grew the company into a commercial wholesale business. At Cloudland Coffee, our philosophy is SAVOR, SUSTAIN, SMILE. Through SAVOR, we are focused on providing our customers and clients high quality coffee that tastes consistently great so that maybe, you don't need to add all that sugar and milk. We want you be able to enjoy the coffee as naturally as possible. With SUSTAIN, we are focused on environmental and economic sustainability. All of our coffee is organic certified at origin and/or Rain Forest Alliance certified. We also try to source coffee that is Fair Trade certified. Additionally our 12oz retail packaging is made from materials that are recyclable and/or compostable. Finally SMILE. From seed to cup and further out to our community, we want to be good stewards. Through our Women Coffee Producer program, we seek out the possibility of working with women owned and operated farms/cooperatives. Closer to home, we do our best to see what we can do to help local charities and to support other fellow local small businesses. By integrating these values into our company to help our community and the world be a better place for the farmers, our employees and our customers, we hope that we will put a smile on your face.
name: Cloudland Coffee Company

description:
Union Trading is a company specialized in coffee trading and exports, with headquarters in the city of São Paulo, Brazil. Union belongs to Icona Café group, established in Madrid, Spain in 1954 and since 1996 has been dedicated to the international coffee trade. (www.iconacafe.com)

With representation offices in important markets like Vietnam and Uganda, Icona started doing business in Brazil in 2005 to expand its coffee acquisitions from the country. With an office in Santos, the company created solid bases that allowed it to found Union Trading in 2010 as a means to continue developing the representation business as well as being an independent coffee exporter.

Union Trading is composed by a team of specialists in coffee trading, quality control and exports. Apart from the main office in São Paulo, Union has buying units in Espírito Santo do Pinhal and Varginha and representation offices in Franca, Londrina, Manhuaçu and Campos Altos, being present in the main coffee producing regions of Brazil. 

The Icona Café group, headquartered in Madrid, Spain, has a strong presence in five countries, among them Brazil, the largest coffee producer and exporter, Vietnam and Uganda. The organization also has an office in Uruguay dedicated in logistics.
name: Union Trading

description:
Specialty Coffee Direct Trade

The Andrade family history began in 1901, with their ancestors at Capim Branco Farm, in Carmo do Paranaíba, High Cerrado, state of Minas Gerais. With the aim to produce high quality coffees, the new generation of Andrade family established their farms in this region during the 70’s. This region has an altitude between 1.100 and 1.200 meters, which provides ideal conditions for growing coffee due to its perfect balance of wet and dry seasons.

In the early 90´s, with the need for expansion of coffee production, quality and volume improvement, the brothers acquired São Silvestre farm in Serra do Salitre, state of Minas Gerais, this farm produces high quality coffees because of its climate and altitude between 1.100 and 1.200 meters.

Combined with the natural conditions of the region, the correct management of crops, crop planning and post-harvest with selection criteria of cherries, grains and natural drying, the results are excellent quality, award-winning beans, appreciated worldwide.

The volcanic soils are perfect for growing Yellow Icatu, Yellow Catuaí and Red Catuai varietals, which thrives here and accounts for the majority of the farm’s yield. This is where Brazil’s best natural coffee beans are produced.

In 1991 through the initiative of twelve producers, who envisioned the opportunities that investing in the quality of the coffee would bring, they founded the BSCA ( Brazil Specialty Coffee Association) that supports all small coffee producers in the region, not only that, it also helps producers improve quality, which improves sustainability. Helping producers to reach out for the importers worldwide, with eco-friendly coffee is another activity that BSCA performs. We are proud to say that we are founders of the BSCA.

We founded an exporting company, which means that we have a direct relationship with our customers, sending our coffee from origin on a Direct Trade basis.
name: Andrade Bros | Estate Coffees

description:
Our Vision is to become a leader at the intersection of coffee and health. 

Our Mission is to create the world’s healthiest coffee. We’ll accomplish our mission through a commitment to research, transparency and the scientific process. Also through continuous improvement in the way our coffee is sourced, roasted, delivered, and measured. The result is that as many people as possible learn about coffee’s disease preventing powers, and choose to drink Purity because of the superior health profile. Our Unique Value Proposition: Today, Purity Coffee is the only coffee company in the world that makes every decision – from seed to cup – to minimize negative compounds and maximize the beneficial attributes of the coffee bean. 

Our Belief System: We believe that your choice in coffee is one of the easiest adjustments you can make for your overall health and longevity.

We believe coffee is good for you - 19,000 scientific studies have been conducted on coffee and health. Taken as a whole, these studies overwhelmingly show that coffee is much more than just a delivery system for caffeine… It is a natural superfood, with astounding health benefits – and it has many compounds such as chlorogenic acid (CGA), lignans, quinides, trigonelline and magnesium to help reduce insulin resistance and systemic inflammation.

We believe that the health benefits of coffee can be enhanced – through conscious sourcing, roasting and processing. 

We believe that drinking more healthy coffee is one of the easiest, highest leverage changes the average person can make to significantly enhance their health and wellness.

We believe that not all coffee is created equal. Purity’s unique protocol was developed under the direction and guidance of a world-class team of scientists, professors and researchers, lead by one of the top coffee scientists in the world, Dr. Adriana Farah. We’ve increased the health benefits of our coffee by eliminating or minimizing acrylamide, PAH, pesticides, and mycotoxins – and by roasting to maximize healthy CGA’s. After years of painstaking research and innovation, our lab results bare out the fact that Purity is the purest coffee available today.

When it comes to the health benefits of coffee, there is a major gap between what science knows and what consumers think. Educating consumers regarding the health benefits of coffee is more than just important – it can save people’s lives. If people knew what we know about the health benefits of coffee, fewer people would suffer and die from the diseases upon which coffee has a profound positive effect; such as fatty liver disease, liver cirrhosis, liver cancer, type II diabetes, stroke, and heart disease. 

We believe that if consumers knew what we know about coffee, they would use HEALTH as a criteria to purchase, in addition to cost, taste and convenience. This would transform the coffee industry and make the world a better, healthier place. When health becomes a criteria for purchasing coffee, coffee companies will be motivated to improve their processes in the farms and at the roasters, because they will have economic incentives to do so. That in turn will compensate the farmers to pay more attention to the quality of their crop and will lead to a living wage for more farmers because there will be a larger price gap between high quality coffee and commodity coffee. 

We believe that using health as our single criteria for the coffee we produce means that we will continue to innovate to a better and better product for our customers. 

We believe that we have just taken the first steps on a much longer journey. Coffee is an incredibly complicated product made up of thousands of compounds that are both created and destroyed in roasting.
 
We believe that we have just taken the first steps on a much longer journey. That we need to continue to innovate and enroll world class doctors and scientists to join the conversation.
name: Purity Coffee

Companies specializing in coffee roasting in Germany

description:
Traveling overseas in the 1970s, Garry Schuil experienced a cup of coffee unlike any he’d ever tasted--remarkably better than the low-grade coffees sold in the U.S. at the time. So in 1981, long before you knew what a latte was, Garry started importing and roasting the world’s best arabica coffee beans and became the first coffee roaster in Michigan focused on high-scoring coffees (aka “specialty” coffees).

Garry cared about bean quality, roasting consistency, and product freshness and wanted to provide all of it at a great value. Several decades later, the Schuil team remains committed to upholding Garry’s vision and legacy. Discover for yourself why discerning coffee drinkers pass up the big brands and choose products from our small, family-owned company proudly based in Grand Rapids, MI.
name: Schuil Coffee Company

description:
For us, coffee is a source of wonder.
  
Since 2005, Wonderstate has roasted spectacular coffees that spark connections, inspire curiosity, and build integrity across communities.
  
Sometimes we feel like tiny specs in the great coffee cosmos. But like the small Midwest town we call home, we know you don’t have to be big to make an impression. From our 100% solar powered roastery, to our industry-leading minimum price guarantee to farmers and 5% Giving program, we’re working to do our part.
name: Wonderstate Coffee

description:
JAVA has always stood for freshness and quality the bean, great customer service, fair treatment of co-workers as well as farmers who go the extra mile to bring to market great coffee, and a sustainable approach to life. We are seeing an increasing number of roasters opening for business every year. To stay ahead JAVA must also go the extra mile, it is not about roasting the most coffee but roasting the best coffee and to make sure farmers are paid well to keep them in business. Without amazing green beans to roast, JAVA is a dodo. For that reason a key objective of JAVA is paying farmers well. We do not call it Fairtrade, we call it Fairly Traded.

The Fairtrade base price of $3.09 per KG of Arabica coffee has not changed since 2011. It is the same price internationally regardless of the big differences in economic and currency dynamics of each region.

In 2019 The Colombia Coffee Federation called for an international base price of $4.12 per KG so producers have a guaranteed income that would prevent farmers from abandoning the sector.

Fact: JAVA pays more to farmers for good coffee. JAVA's our current coffees start at 70% premium to the Fairtrade Arabica base price. 

The graphic below demonstrates the average % premium JAVA pays for good coffee from origins we source from ABOVE the Fairtrade minimum base price of $3.09 per KG for Arabica washed coffee worldwide. The period measured is January to June 2022.
name: JAVA Coffee Company

description:
Drinking coffee is pleasure - Every successful coffee company knows that not just any coffee bean creates it. We offer beans that can: Coffee from Yemen. 

Yemen is one of coffee's native countries and continues to be the origin of one of the highest quality coffee beans on earth still today. The popular mocha coffee stems from the mountains of Yemen and is characterized by its unique flavors as well as a high genetic diversity. As a globally appreciated product, the Yemeni bean needs no further explanation. However, due to the country's internal political developments in recent years, its supply has been anything but easy. With us, that's changing now! 

Being compatriots, we benefit from direct connections to coffee farmers in Yemen and experts, researchers, and laboratory technicians as partners at our side. Thus, not only do we have an efficient network that enables fast delivery tailored to your needs, but more importantly, also access to comprehensive, valuable knowledge about the Yemeni product and its value chain. This allows us to provide highest safety and quality. The latter has already been confirmed by several, partly well-known roasting companies.

Customs Support is the neutral and digital customs partner for companies in Europe. A fast pacing company that stands for knowledge, customs compliance and efficient IT solutions.

We have extended our services with gas measurements, veterinary declarations and consultancy to make sure goods move through their supply chain and across borders safely, efficiently and without hassle or delay. We invest heavily in IT and digital services to offer customers a real-time overview of processes and to become the number one digital customs partner.

Customs procedures can be complex. Laws and regulations are constantly evolving and changing. Each change can have big implications for shippers. Our experts follow these changes closely and always work in accordance with the latest regulations. In order to optimise cooperation with all our customers and their relations, we invest extra in training our specialists and in technology & innovation. In this way, we can also continue to comply with the AEO conditions.

For companies, these customs regulations can seem like an unfathomable jungle. Our specialists know how to find their way through this jungle.

Customs Support!

Hanze Supply is a reliable supplier of various product groups. We distribute beauty, cosmetics, pharma and FMCG in Europe and far beyond. Our customers include web shops, retail chains, trading companies and wholesalers.

The company originated from the idea of the old Hanze Alliance. This was a partnership of merchants and cities during the Middle Ages. By cooperating, they tried to protect and expand their trade. From the middle of the twelfth century, alliances of Dutch and German merchants arose around the North and Baltic Seas. At Hanze Supply, collaboration is of paramount importance. We value long term and steady relationships with our business partners.

What is our added value? Hanze Supply manages a large portfolio of brands in multiple markets. This enables us to supply many customers. Thanks to our many years of experience in this industry, we can offer our partners the best products for the best price. Hanze Supply is always looking for new opportunities and expansion of our business. We are young and active and we always anticipate the latest market trends.

Our markets is in constant motion. Dynamic! Hanze Supply is there to help its customers wherever possible with the focus on a long-term relationship.
name: Hanze Supply

description:
A WORLDWIDE PERSPECTIVE
Sucden is an independent leader in soft commodities trading. We combine global know-how with local expertise to connect supply and demand in a sustainable way. While doing so, we serve our clients and partners with quality and integrity.
We trade on the world’s major exchanges in a wide range of products and services including sugar, coffee, cocoa, ethanol, ocean freight and futures/options brokerage. In support, we are active in agriculture and sourcing, processing, logistics, distribution, merchandising and risk management.

SUCDEN CREATES OPPORTUNITIES
Our advantage is that we trade worldwide on all the major markets and act in every capacity from production to processing and distribution. Our approach is to identify and capture value for our clients whenever and wherever the supply and demand balance changes and the markets move.

GLOBAL REACH
Our entrepreneurial and professional team of more than 4,000 employees in over 25 locations worldwide originates and ships more than 10 million tonnes of soft commodities every year. We do this globally through our agricultural, processing and logistical activities encompassing operations in places as far afield as Russia, Brazil, Mexico, India, Europe, the USA and several African and Latin American locations.

SOLID FOUNDATIONS
Since our formation in 1952, Sucden has built a reliable and trustworthy reputation for expertise in soft commodities. Today the company is still privately owned. We are led by Serge Varsano, the son of our founding partner, from our corporate headquarters in Paris, France.
name: SUCDEN Groupe Sucres & Denrées

description:
INO Building Materials & Tools Trading LLC is a leading Dubai company in the development and manufacture of abrasive tools on bakelite bonds. At the time of launch in 2012, the company produced 35 types of cut-off and grinding wheels on bakelite bond with reinforcing elements. At the beginning of 2021, the company produces more than 150 types of products in 3 Quality series. We also trade other construction materials and tools with high quality and warranty.

The six-stage product quality control system enabled us to freely pass the QMS ISO 9001 certification in 2015. As a result, in 2018, all subsequent stages of the companies have been developed by the R&D Center using Quality Management System - Continuous Growth and Improvement.

The result of research in the field of heat treatment of grinding materials was the launch of serial production of the premium segment of cut-off and grinding wheels INO Extreme.

Our team of professionals aims to provide complete technical support in selecting the necessary abrasive tools. Based on many years of production experience, innovation, and importance
in the abrasive industry, the company is ready not only to develop the necessary tools for the customer, but also to customize or create a new tool and meet the needs of each customer together.

Contact us:
+971 585 866 007 (Whatsapp / Telegram)
ceo@ino.ae
salesmanager@ino.ae

Best regards,
INO Building Materials & Tools Trading LLC team
name: INO Building materials and tools trading LLC

KnowDetech is a leader that is more than capable of providing solutions for your needs.

description:
Immer Inc is an international agri trading group with offices in Amsterdam, Singapore, India, Vietnam and Thailand. We sell Rice and Sugar from India and Thailand and Green Coffee Beans from Vietnam and Indonesia. 
Immer Inc is focused on agro products and waste based feedstock POME, UCO, Fatty acids for biodiesel & biofuels UCOME, SAF, HVO
Our team consists of professionals who bring with them long experience in Commodity Trading, Logistics, Finance and Commodity Markets. The team has been able to successfully use its smaller size to its advantage and is complementary with the larger trade houses. We have a well-diversified set of buyers 
For Rice and Sugar, we sell to several large and mid-sized companies across Asia and Europe. 

Our team of Rice and Sugar Traders are based in India and ideally placed to cater to the huge and growing demand. Our traders bring with them deep understanding of local market and extensive relationships with millers, logistics partners, customs handling agencies and independent inspection agencies. We buy directly from Indian rice mills and sugar refineries to ensure that our customer gets the best value in terms of quality and price. It also helps us to monitor and maintain same quality every time for our customers. All our shipments are inspected by reputed third party inspection agencies. 

In the last 4 years Immer has established its reputation in the market by handling several shipments be it container or break-bulk and including full vessel shipments. We ensure that that all our shipments are on time and any delays or over-runs on account of containers availability, port congestion, vessel delays are clearly identified and communicated in a timely and transparent manner with all our buyers. 

We export to several destinations like Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Madagascar, Benin, Cotonou, Niger,Djibouti, Ivory Coast, Togo, Somalia, Uganda, Angola, Saudi Arabia.
name: Immer Inc

description:
MGT International markets a variety of raw and processed meat products, frozen vegetables and fruits coming from different parts of the world, especially North America, Europe, and South America. The company’s  headquarters are located in Miami, Florida, with offices also in Colombia.

MGT offers high quality products with a wide variety of commodities to value-added products. We work closely with different types of partners, such as distributors, processing companies, and supermarket chains. 

An extensive experience in the red meat, poultry, fish, seafood, fruit, and vegetable markets are among the advantages we offer. Our competitive edge lies in our great customer service and the ability to supply our customers even when the market variations and the limited supply propose a challenge. All these factors have helped MGT International draw loyal customers and grow its market share little by little.
name: MG Trading International

description:
Initially, our main activity was to import and distribute in the local private market the major foodstuffs such as dairy products, cereals, sugar, tea, coffee, and raw materials.

In 1980, the prohibition of importation faced by the private sector in Syria obliged us to deal with the public sector by participating in their international tenders for the range of products of our main activity especially the rice, sugar, and wheat and, at the same time, we diversified above activity while participating indirectly in many of the turnkey projects tenders as the exclusive agent of the companies or consortiums that we organized especially for these tenders.

In 1985 and due to the lack of foreign currencies in Syria, we succeed by personal efforts, to realize for the first time in the history of Syria two private Protocols of barter deal between the Ministry of Planning in Syria and two European companies.

In addition, we managed and executed many barter transactions, among them someones to recover debts due by Syria to worldwide pharmaceutical manufactures and others for a specific purpose such as the case of a contract with Aleppo railways for the supply of wagons to General Company for Phosphate and Mines which we executed against Syrian Rock Phosphate.

On the other hand, we have been also involved in the Syrian crude oil business where we granted to ARCADIA PETROLEUM LIMITED - UK a long-term contract to lift Syrian light crude oil that has been revolving for many years.
name: GEANT - MT Management & Trading

description:
Fortuna Trading DMCC, based in Dubai, is one of the world’s leading agri-commodities trading houses. Our Group was established in 1992 and, with over 25 years of experience in the trading world, has been consistently bringing value to the industry, emerging as a trusted and credible partner to both customers and suppliers alike. Since inception, Fortuna has been capitalizing on the Group’s history in trading food commodities and animal feed across the Middle East, Africa, Europe as well as various parts of the world, while paving its own path to further grow and cement our influence globally.

Over the years, our team has been striving to grow its presence globally through JVs as well as own set ups, based on strong relationship management and passion towards excellence in terms of service and customer satisfaction. As a part of its mission and vision, the company consistently endeavor to emerge as “one stop solution” for its counter parties involved in this trade, providing comprehensive trading, sourcing and marketing of various agricultural commodities.

We are driven by our ambitious corporate purpose to re-imagine the essence of global agriculture and food systems within our ethos of growing responsibly.
name: Fortuna Trading DMCC

description:
As a small family-owned business, Grupo Farinchi was born with the small farmer in mind and always looking beyond simple trade. We commercialize Specialty Wines from Spain and Specialty Woods and coffee from Costa Rica,  

Our business model is to connect environmental conscious traders in specific industries with organizations in the public and private sectors, for the purpose of offering better alternative sustainability solutions. 

We believe that trading high quality products in a sustainable commerce environment is mainly achieved by carefully selecting our suppliers, their farming practices, and particularities of each specific region such as certain parts of Europe, Costa Rica and USA. 

As part of our business portfolio, we have formed strategic alliances and agreements with non-profit organizations (“NGO”) in Costa Rica with shared objectives focused in Forest Management Programs throughout the country such as: Centro de Inteligencia e Innovación de Negocios Forestales (“CIINFOR”), created to assist La Oficina Nacional Forestal (“ONF”) for the commercialization of FSC® certified (Forest Stewardship Council (fsc.org) timber, and other forest products for the noble cause of providing an economic benefit for the small Forestry farmerss. This operation is fully approved and regulated by the Ministerio de Ambiente y Energía - República de Costa Rica (minae.go.cr) ("MINAE"), The National Regulatory Agency for the Environment and Energy in Costa Rica.
name: Grupo Farinchi

description:
Monjasa is a global partner in the oil and shipping industries. Our core business includes reselling and physical supply of marine fuels and ship-owning activities on a global level. 

Monjasa was established in Denmark in 2002 and has developed into a global top 10 marine fuels supplier. Today, we employ 600+ Traders and other maritime specialists and total revenue reached USD 5.5bn in 2022 - equivalent to 6.4 million tonnes of marine fuels supplied. 

With office locations in Europe, the Americas, the Middle East & Africa and Asia we are present in all major time zones and always within reach. We are servicing industry leading shipping companies locally and globally in more than 800 ports worldwide and our fleet of some 30 tankers and barges has helped us reach prominent positions in remote and hard-to-reach markets in West Africa, Panama, USA, Northwest Europe and in the Middle East. 

Monjasa emerges from true entrepreneurship and the outspoken conviction that excellence and ownership in what we do must drive our company forward. We have a strong commitment to compliance and through our ISO and OHSAS certifications, we are part of an exclusive club of quality bunker suppliers. We are certified according to ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001 and ISO 50001 and all of our oil products meet the latest specifications of ISO 8217.

In terms of financial capability and performance, Monjasa is positioned among the most robust bunker companies in the world with consolidated equity of USD 323m and a solvency ratio of 46%.

www.monjasa.com/privacy-and-cookie-notice/
name: Monjasa

description:
We live tea. Since 1879, in Hamburg and around the world.

Hälssen & Lyon is one of the leading and traditional tea companies in Europe with it headquarters in Hamburg’s historic warehouse district ‘Speicherstadt’ and a large production site and warehouse in Hamburg-Allermöhe. Since its foundation in 1879, the company has been family-owned. At Hälssen & Lyon everything revolves around tea, in any imaginable form and all under one roof. Besides premium teas from all of the world’s tea regions, the product range comprises fruits, herbs and spices for finest blends, flavoured teas and a large array of instant products up to the bottling of freshly brewed RTD teas. In our own production site, teas are tailor-made for our customers, refined, blended, flavoured and also packed. We are B2B and active in all international markets. Our customer groups are varied too – including tea brands and private label customers, the specialised tea retail, the beverage industry and the food service sector.

Become part of the fascinating world of tea!
Hälssen & Lyon offers great opportunities for working in an international environment built around the multi-faceted product of tea. Our growing company has been family-owned for four generations and uniquely combines tradition and innovation.
Whether at our historic headquarters in Hamburg's Speicherstadt – now a UNESCO World Heritage Site – or at our large plant in the Allermöhe district of Hamburg, we are always happy to welcome dedicated employees.
name: Hälssen & Lyon GmbH

description:
Caraway Tea is a leading women-owned company specializing in the production and distribution of premium teas. With our commitment to excellence, SQF Supplement Certification, and a focus on private label and wholesale tea, we deliver exceptional quality and unmatched service to our valued customers.

As a women-owned business, we take pride in our dedication to empowerment and inclusivity. Our diverse team of experts brings a wealth of knowledge and passion to every aspect of our operations, ensuring that we meet the unique needs of our clients and partners.

With our SQF Supplement Certification, we adhere to the highest standards of safety, quality, and traceability. This certification demonstrates our commitment to providing products that not only taste great but also meet rigorous industry regulations and requirements. You can trust Caraway Tea to deliver safe, reliable, and compliant tea products.

At Caraway Tea, we offer private label and wholesale tea options to cater to a wide range of businesses. Whether you're looking to create your own brand of tea or stock your shelves with our exceptional blends, we have the capabilities and expertise to meet your specific needs. From soothing herbal infusions to invigorating iced teas, our diverse portfolio has something for everyone.

We understand that taste and quality are paramount when it comes to tea, which is why we meticulously source the finest tea leaves and botanicals from around the world. Our experienced team works tirelessly to create unique flavor profiles and blends that delight the senses and satisfy discerning palates.

When you partner with Caraway Tea, you gain a dedicated ally in the world of tea. We provide personalized support and guidance throughout the process, from concept development to packaging and branding. Our goal is to help you succeed by delivering exceptional tea products that resonate with your target audience.

Experience the Caraway Tea difference today.

description:

The company is well known for its flagship brand “Rabea” tea among others, and is proud to be referred to as the “House of Quality Teas”- specialized in innovating & producing different blends, formats and packages. 

Having its own tea factory in Jeddah, & with machinery that can produce up to 400 teabags per minute, AMSB owns the biggest tea factory and the only tea lab in Saudi Arabia.

AMSB is well-known not only for putting quality products on supermarket shelves, but for providing the market with a unique, innovative taste of their favorite hot beverage With more than a century of experience in the Arabian marketplace, it has also earned a reputation for breaking new grounds in marketing, manufacturing, quality and other business practices. description:
As one of this country’s most prestigious tea importers, the Mark T. Wendell Tea Company has been a wholesaler and retailer of fine teas to tea connoisseurs since 1904. 

The Mark T. Wendell Tea Company offers a full range of estate grown specialty teas, signature tea blends, herbal and fruit tisanes, imported packaged tea brands, as well as a wide selection of teapots and tea brewing accessories. They select and purchase their fine teas from tea gardens and tea importers located around the world and obtain teas of only the highest quality. For over 105 years, they have taken great pride in providing customers with the highest levels of customer service, affordable pricing and an unparalleled knowledge into the world of specialty teas.
name: Mark T. Wendell Tea Company

description:
Our Invitation: Slow down, sip and savor.
Here at Heavenly Tea Leaves, we know a busy day can make finding a moment to pause feel impossible. But we also know the power of a good cup of tea. That’s why we carefully source only the most aromatic and flavorful loose leaf teas from around the world. We invite you to enjoy organic teas and wellness blends that sink you into joy, relaxation, and mindfulness. That  revive your energy and focus throughout the day. That help you float gently to sleep at night. We believe you deserve a whole and healthful lifestyle. We’re excited to help you live it.
 
Our Mission: Honest-tea and Integri-tea. 
It’s been a long time since we fell in love with quality loose leaf teas in 2006. Back then, it was hard to find organic, healthful teas with truly transportive properties. And so we started sourcing them ourselves! We promise every loose leaf tea and blend on our menu has been curated with honesty and integrity. All of our teas are allergen-free. Most are organic and certified Kosher, too. (Just look for those designations on their individual pages.) When you pour water over our tea leaves, you’ll immediately sense their natural, lively personalities. You’ll taste quality, freshness, and flavor. We started our family-owned loose leaf tea brand to share the affordable luxury of a fine cup of tea. Welcome to our family.

Our Vision: Minimizing our footprint. Maximizing your bliss.
Eco-friendly packaging has come a long way since we started our loose leaf tea company! We respect the natural world as much as we respect the nature of teas. So we’re continually moving towards more sustainable packaging and shipping practices. All of our full-sized loose leaf teas and our Essentials Collection come in compostable pouches. Our tea samplers come in fun, reusable tins arranged in recyclable kraft paper gift boxes. We blend beauty and sustainability more and more every day.
name: Heavenly Tea Leaves

description:
Let’s get steeped in Stash Tea.
And float in feelings of wonderful wellness.
Where joyful tea leaves whisper into our ears “Happy steeping, teahead.”

Founded in 1972
By Teaheads, For Teaheads

description:
Blue Ocean Tea has decades of experience in the custom formulation of functional and specialty teas. We work collaboratively with our customers to create market-friendly blends. Our approach to business is to build strong relationships with our customers and seek to create a lifetime of value. 

We can support you with:

☕ Tea Sourcing and Importing
☕ Custom Formulation
☕ Contract Manufacturing
☕ Warehousing and Logistics
☕ Consultation and R&D
☕ Wholesale of Bulk Ingredients

When you work with us, you rely on a business with deep experience manufacturing tea products along with all necessary certifications. You also rely on a business that has a successful record of importing from origin: navigating FDA, transport logistics, and other unexpected situations such as tariffs, droughts, and trade wars. We offer you our one core competency: strengthening and protecting robust supply chains from plant to packaged product.

We engage in strategic partnerships rather than transactional relationships. Blue Ocean Tea has extensive experience working with many specialty tea brands in North America and Europe, including Justea and Superbolt Tea.

description:
At Tea Amo, our vision is to inspire a world that embraces the artistry and tranquility of tea. We strive to be the catalyst for moments of connection, self-care, and mindful indulgence, where every sip becomes a soulful journey.
By meticulously curating exceptional teas from around the globe, we aim to delight and enchant tea enthusiasts with an exquisite sensory experience. Our commitment to sourcing the finest ingredients and employing sustainable practices ensures that every cup of tea reflects our deep respect for nature and its bountiful gifts.

With unwavering dedication to craftsmanship, innovation, and the timeless traditions of tea, we aspire to elevate tea culture to new heights. We envision creating a space where tea becomes more than a beverage—it becomes a means of personal rejuvenation, cultural appreciation, and shared moments of serenity.

Driven by a passion for excellence, we constantly push boundaries, experimenting with unique blends, captivating flavors, and elegant packaging that appeals to discerning palates and artistic sensibilities. We embrace diversity, honoring the rich heritage of tea while fostering a spirit of exploration and discovery.
name: Tea Amo

description:

With our partnership with Thirst Project, Tea Drops has provided access to clean water to over 50,000 individuals and counting. 

1st Place $100,000 Tory Burch Foundation Business with Impact Grant
1st Place $50,000 PepsiCo-FritoLay Woman Owned Business
1st Place $20,000 Woman Founder's Network Pitch 

Fair Trade | Organic | Mission Driven | Venture Backed

description:

Brew La La Coffee, a line of gourmet coffee specializing in dessert blends. All of our coffees are made from 100% Arabica beans. Some of our most popular flavors are Red Velvet Cupcake, Coffee Ice Cream, Caramel Swirl, Tiramisu Coffee & many more. Now you can enjoy your favorite desserts without all the guilt!   

We are extremely excited to announce the launch of our newest line of 100% Organic tea, Brew La La Tea. Brew La La Tea is USDA Organic certified and available in 13 delicious and refreshing flavors. 

All of our products are created with what we like to call our ingredients for success: love, passion, creativity, joy and a great sense of humor all mixed into one. 

It is our mission to help make the world a sweeter place.... never forget in a world where candy rules, everyone’s day is a little sweeter!

This vision still guides the Milo’s Difference today as we continue source all natural ingredients, fresh brew our teas, and never use acids, colors, or preservatives in any of our beverages. Our commitment to the integrity of the vision of our founder is what we know makes Milo’s the best. Drink Milo’s and you will Taste the Difference.

description:
Delicious, Meet Healthy.

Welcome to The Ryl Company™, the beverage platform behind Ryl Tea™.

BUT:

Ryl™ is not another iced tea brand, there’s enough good options of those already.

Ryl™ is a functional tea brand, because functional stuff doesn’t usually play in delicious categories like iced tea.

Our mission? Create the First Healthy Drink That Doesn’t Suck. 

Ryl Tea™ is a 0 sugar, 0 calorie, perfectly sweetened, 100% recyclable tea made with our proprietary Ryl™  Polyphenol Technology. 

Our team believes that the “Functional Focus” shift is upon us and the definition of “better-for-you” is evolving… but other new brands seem to want to stick to the easy stuff and avoid adding more to their products.

Until now. Ryl™ is focused on being a real (no pun intended) incremental growth driver to several multibillion beverage categories that are notorious for delicious taste and subpar nutrition labels. Starting with iced tea.

Follow our journey and let us take you into the next phase of evolution in the beverage universe: the functional era.
name: The Ryl Company™

description:
Lira Brand daton nga viti 1992 kryesisht në Republikën e Kosovës, duke na bërë një nga markat më të vjetra të çajit në vend.
Për vite me radhë Lira Brand ka qenë lider në tregun e Kosovës duke ofruar çajra cilësorë për klientët e saj. Gjatë viteve ku kanë kaluar gati 30 vite punë, kjo na ka bërë edhe më të përgjegjshëm, duke qenë gjithmonë besnikë ndaj klientëve tanë, cilësia dhe traditës kanë qenë ato që e kanë bërë të veçantë në treg me të tjerët. Si një markë me traditë, kjo tashmë e ka bërë të qartë vizionin tonë, ku çdo ditë e më shumë arrijmë objektivat tona, duke na bërë edhe më të suksesshëm dhe afër kërkesave të klientëve tanë.

Lira Brand dates from 1992 mainly in the Republic of Kosovo, making us one of the oldest tea brands in the country.
For years Lira Brand has been a leader in the Kosovo market by offering quality teas to its customers. During the years where almost 30 years of work have passed, this has made us even more responsible, always being loyal to our customers, quality and tradition have been what have made it special in the markets with others. As a brand with tradition, this has already made clear our vision, where every day more and more we achieve our goals, making us even more successful and close to customer requirements.

description:
Here at Chatime, building great partnerships is our priority. 
By becoming part of our Chatime family, you will enjoy a lot of privileges and support, from efficient supply chain management, comprehensive training package, product and system’s innovation to game-changing marketing programs and toolkits to ensure your business success.

Founded in Taiwan in 2005, Chatime has been providing millions of customers around the world with wide selections of freshly brewed tea-creating fun and trendy customer experience.

Now operating across 58 countries worldwide, Chatime becomes one of the largest bubble tea brands in the world with key locations in Australia, Canada, Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Japan, UK, USA, Northern Europe, Mainland China and more! We continuously grow, bigger and wider, tapping into new markets. Recently included in our portfolio are Germany, The Netherlands, and Palau. Chatime is a publicly–listed company with stock value quadrupled in 2019 under its mother company La Kaffa.

description:
Kung Fu, in its purest essence, is the desire for self-improvement and to expand one's capabilities beyond all limitations.

Here at Kung Fu Tea, we share that same desire. We hold the firm belief that it is our mission to continuously improve and expand upon our already stellar brand.

With over a decade of experience, we are the unchallenged experts in the bubble tea business. From the ingredients for our products to the customer service at our stores, we keep a strict and uncompromisingly high standard, setting the bar for our competitors.

It is our dream to introduce the Kung Fu Tea brand to consumers all around the world, as well as creating a more refined bubble tea culture. For this reason, we are looking for business partners who might be interested in joining us. With your help, we hope to expand our market even further. We are thrilled to announce that we will be opening in Canada this year! And more countries to come.

Our corporate headquarters are currently located in New York City. We have business ventures in North America, Australia, and Canada.
