description:
The Spice & Tea Exchange® Mission: “Creating & sharing the experience of a more flavorful life.”  We do this through our 89 stores. Each store offers retail opportunity, wholesale opportunity, and a tea bar. 

The Spice & Tea Exchange® was founded in 2008 by a group of talented individuals with a passion for life and food. Our mission statement "Creating & sharing the experience of a more flavorful life,"​ is the cornerstone on which our company which strives to provide guests with quality products and flavorful memories.

Each store carries over 670 products all fresh, all innovative. The Spice & Tea Exchange® offers teas, spices, exclusive hand-mixed blends, naturally flavored sugars, an array of salts from around the world. We focus on providing high quality products and accessories to home cooks, chefs, and tea lovers in an old-world spice traders’ atmosphere.
Franchises are available in many U.S. states and territories. You can live the flavor life and own your own store. This is an opportunity to join a distinctively different and exciting business venture in a growth market. It is our mission to provide each The Spice & Tea Exchange® franchise with the highest standards of assistance, training, and support; from our first conversation, to build-out and store preparation, and throughout their existence. We invite you to visit us online to learn more about our unique concept and Franchise experience: http://franchise.spiceandtea.com/franchise.
name: The Spice & Tea Exchange®

description: Tea with Tae is a woman-owned tea company offering premium teas sourced from some of the most exquisite and finest tea farms in the world. Our tea is served in eco-friendly tea sachets to preserve the sophisticated flavor profiles and aromas of each tea, while maintaining the convenience of a tea bag. It's the best of both worlds, especially for those who are constantly on the move and hustling everyday!
name: Tea with Tae

description:
30 years ago in Salisbury, Connecticut, proprietor of the historic White Hart Inn, John Harney, developed a passion for fine teas. John was introduced to the world of tea by Stanley Mason, who turned to creating his own craft tea blends after years in the corporate world of tea. Over time, Mason taught John both the art and business of the craft.

Starting production out of his basement in 1983, John began his own journey in mastering the craft of tea blending. Serving his distinctive blends with inn guests, he soon found they were coming back for more. Never did John Harney imagine that his small home-run business in Salisbury, Connecticut would turn into a global operation, now headquartered in Millerton, New York filling 90,000 square feet of warehouse space, and employing over 155 people, making it one of the largest employers in the Hudson Valley. The company, which sources, blends, and packages their own product from start to finish, has grown from their original six teas, to more than three hundred. Their story truly captures the essence of American Business Ingenuity.

Harney & Sons was founded on a commitment to deliver customers the finest quality tea possible. This promise, made 30 years ago, serves as the company's guiding principle. Today, Harney & Sons Tea remains family owned and managed, with three generations of Harney's preserving John's tradition of fine tea and traveling the world in search of the finest ingredients.
name: Harney and Sons Fine Teas

description:
Here at Hi Tea, we make great tasting loose leaf tea and whole leaf teabags; blended right here in the UK. These teas are perfect for cafes, bars, restaurants, hotels and conference centres to add value and increase tea revenues. 

Our core collection consists of ten teas. This diverse range contains black tea, green tea, white tea and herbal infusions which are mouth watering and utterly different. We can also create completely bespoke tea blends. 

With the ability to provide both loose leaf tea & silk pyramid tea bags with low minimum orders and exceptional levels of service to help you create the perfect customer experience; we think you'll find us to be a no-brainer when looking for your next tea supplier.
name: Hi Tea

description:
Family-owned and operated, Senbird is the world's leading Japanese tea producer, supplier, and innovator. From Kyoto to Shizuoka and Hokkaido, we bring you the finest tea from family farms across Japan. 

With a focus on wellness and sustainability, Senbird is committed to providing high-quality organic Japanese tea for retailers, cafes, restaurants, and businesses of all sizes. Our offerings range from wholesale retail tea, bulk tea service, private events, custom corporate tea gifts, and more. Although our tea is all grown in Japan, sales and fulfillment are handled domestically in the US, resulting in shorter lead times and lower minimums. 

As a team of tea lovers, we’re dedicated to inspiring more moments of appreciation through our fine green tea and herbal tea collection, premium gift sets, and handcrafted teaware. Join our journey to share the rich traditions of Japanese tea in nurturing a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

For more information, visit www.senbirdtea.com
name: Senbird Tea

description:
Sipping Streams Tea Company founder, Jenny Tse, was born in Hong Kong, but raised in Fairbanks, Alaska. She spent her summers selling her mother's vegetables at the local farmer's market and was very active in the local community. 

Her vision for Sipping Streams began the summer of 2004 where she began to notice how tea brought different people together. Traveling to different tea farms in China encouraged her to teach about tea in her local community. Tse is a certified tea specialist with the Specialty Tea Institute. Her hand blends and teas have won 1st, 2nd, and 3rd at the North American Tea Championships. Sipping Streams Tea Company was featured in the Tea Almanac of Fresh Cup Magazine 2009, has spoken at the World Tea Expo, and won 1st place for the Top Tea Infusionist Competition at the World Tea Expo 2011.

"We believe in the best quality of life for our mind, body, and soul. And encourage a community of diverse culture and age where people can come together and grow to know who they are."
–Jenny Tse, Owner
name: Sipping Streams Tea Company

description:
Nature Leaf Teas is a mission-based tea company that was founded with a simple yet powerful vision - to bring the goodness of nature to everyone's cup! We Provide an honest and great tasting tea experience that nourishes our customer’s minds, bodies, and souls so that we may provide for children in need.

Through partnering with non-profit organizations; our profits provide for children in Colombia and throughout the world.

Our teas and herbs are all natural with no preservatives, colorants or additives for the healthiest and purest teas. We use PCR packaging, treating our mother earth with love and kindness. We customize each cup to your desired benefit and taste, and also offer no hassle subscription-based service.

The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.
name: Nature Leaf Teas, Inc.

description:
Purveyors of Fine Japanese Green Tea. Direct-trade and organic teas from the fields of Uji, Japan.

Mizuba Tea Co started with a simple fact: Japan grows and produces the best Matcha green tea in the world.

After visiting a remote region called Uji, known for it's vast green tea fields and delicious Matcha, we were inspired to bring this amazing product to the States. Enter Mizuba Matcha. We import high quality, artisanal Matcha green tea from a 100-year-old family farm in Uji, Japan. Our teas can be found in local food stores and restaurants on the California coast, as well as on our website at www.mizubatea.com. 

Mizuba Tea Co.
www.mizubatea.com

description:
One of the 25 Best Coffee Shops in the World You have to see before You Die!’

Buzzfeed, counts Kronotrop among the 25 best coffee shops in the world to see before you

die. Comprised of the best the Coffee World has to offer, the list includes Blue Bottle Coffee (Oakland, U.S), Stumptown Coffee Roasters (Portland, U.S.), Bonanza Coffee (Berlin, Germany) along with Kronotrop based in Istanbul.

‘Kronotrop, 6th in the World Coffee Roasting Championship!

Located in buzzy venues like Cihangir, Moda, Bebek, Topağacı, Ataşehir, Feneryolu has hit the ground offering an exciting experience to coffee enthusiasts. All coffees have been traded in direct contact with the farmers, with full traceability, fresh harvests, and all of them with outstanding flavors in common. Our passionate roasters magically blend their unique vision with the raw underlying characters of the beans to yield an unprecedented result at each roasting.

In addition to vibrant and successful coffee bars in Istanbul, Kronotrop is rapidly moving forward with the help of its state of the art roasting facility, and an R&D and training center.

The team proudly uses the “greenest” roaster in the world “Loring Smartroast,” The Loring is particularly known for being extremely precise with extraordinarily pure tastes as a result. As the favorite roasting equipment of many roast masters, Loring constitutes only one part of the process. The Kronotrop team’s approach is that great coffee rests on a delicate balance between science and art, and so they relentlessly continue their research and training.

The Kronotrop Roastmasters and Baristas, who are the leaders of third wave coffee artisanship in Turkey, have been representing Turkey in World Championships for the last three years.

Having recently launched their new wholesale brand ‘no33 Coffee’, the Kronotrop team is broadening their reach in the Coffee World with an unwavering devotion and unfading curiosity.
name: Kronotrop Coffee Bar & Roastery

With the August 63 mobile coffee roastery, I focus on specialty coffee, which is characterized by high quality, transparency and sustainability. It is important to me that everyone within the production chain benefits. Therefore, I pay a higher price for the green coffee, target project coffees to ensure an impact in the countries of origin. Whether espresso or filter coffee, for your office or for yourself at home - soon you will find the right coffee for your needs in the August 63 online store. Official launch on 09/15/2021!!! This is just the beginning and I look forward to welcoming you on my way.

description:
Vienna Coffee Company, LLC and its affiliate VCH, LLC dba Vienna Coffee House are independent, quality centric “Craft” coffee operations headquartered in Maryville, Tennessee. We small batch roast and distribute only Specialty Grade coffees, equipment and café supplies to Coffeehouse, restaurant and retail customers in Tennessee and the southeast. Vienna was named as Tennessee’s entry in its list of “The Best Coffee Roasters in All 50 States” by mental_floss in September, 2016.

Mission, Vision, and Values
Our Mission: Vienna Coffee Company, LLC arouses a lifetime passion for coffee by helping people to procure, prepare and serve the very best, freshest specialty coffees available and by teaching coffee lovers how to appreciate it.

Our Vision: Vienna Coffee hopes to become the regionally recognized leader in specialty coffee preparation and enjoyment for East Tennessee and the Southeast. To achieve that vision we must provide the absolute best product available anywhere and actively teach our customers and their patrons how to appreciate the experience. Consumer education will be a key ingredient in our offering.

Our Values: Vienna Coffee will conduct ourselves and our business with transparency and adherence to the principals embodied in the concept of the Triple Bottom Line. We will evaluate each undertaking with respect to its potential for sustainability and its impact on People, Planet, and Profit. The people we care about include our customers; our staff, their friends and families; our suppliers, importers and US trade partners; and the hundreds of coffee farming families who cultivate, pick, process and export these fine coffees. We subscribe to the reality that we are called to be good stewards of the Earth. We will look to constantly improve our resource utilization and “walk more softly” on the planet. We expect to make a reasonable profit from our efforts such that the business is sustainable and our owners are rewarded for their labors.
name: Vienna Coffee Company, LLC

description:
https://www.instagram.com/dittaartigianale/

It all started in 2013 when Francesco Sanapo participated in his last competition in Melbourne, Australia, finishing sixth in the grand final with 60 nations from all over the world. At that moment Francesco, representing Italy in the world of coffee, felt the need to do something in Italy, give a new impetus and start an innovative path reflecting our traditions, with international style and Italian hospitality. Ditta Artigianale was about to be born.

Ditta Artigianale is the idea of ​emphasizing Italian craftsmanship and the culture of doing, or re-focusing work on quality and craftsmanship in the coffee world.

Once back from the world championship, the first steps in this direction began, first opening the roasting plant to roast in collaboration with Brambati. Subsequently, after the launch of the online site, the desire to take to the streets, on the street, to communicate with the people, with the customers grew to pass the passion and the enthusiasm that move daily the engine of Ditta Artigianale.

Going to the street was combined with the opening of the first café, Ditta Artigianale coffee bar located in via de 'Neri, 32r where the adventure that led in less than a year to inaugurate the second restaurant in via dello Sprone began. , Ditta Artigianale Oltrarno, on the other bank of the Arno river, and then the third, a new experiment opened in collaboration with the cinema company, where a café was opened inside the historic Florentine theater, the first Specialty d '​ Italy. Ditta Artigianale is also inspired by the numerous trips made by Francesco Sanapo in the plantation in the various producing countries in search of the most exclusive and ethical coffees, creating a direct contact with each individual producer based on trust and mutual respect, but above all focused on quality coffee.
name: Ditta Artigianale

description:
Macenta Beans is a unique Fine Robusta from South Eastern Guinea in West Africa. A region benefiting from a microclimate creating unique conditions that enables the growth of a high quality & flavourful bean.

Our green coffee is directed at high end at small and medium sized roasters looking for a specific Robusta bean to mix with their existing product lines with a direct and certifiable sourcing from the farms in Guinea or to roast as a single 100% Robusta as the quality of our coffee is excellent. 

Macenta Beans is a inclusive and local company that respects each individual that works for the creation of a coffee cup. We truly believe that Robusta producers who work intensively and passionately on the quality of their products should receive the same recognition and reward as Specialty Arabica producers. We will be providing a premium to all our producers and will invest part of our profits to the local ecosystem.

description:
About Kaffeeform
Kaffeeform is a sustainable material made from used coffee grounds and other renewable resources. As a coffee cup, it is given the perfect new life. 

Founded 2015 in in Berlin, Kaffeeform relies on short, green routes alongside local, social partners and production in Germany. It promotes the principles of the circular economy and reuse of raw materials. The product range includes espresso, cappuccino, and latte cups as well as the award-winning Weducer cup for coffee on the go. All cups are exceptionally durable, light, and have a mild coffee aroma.
name: Kaffeeform

description: CUPCUP is a coffee shop on your smartphone. We prepare delicious coffee, tea, cold drinks, desserts. We deliver in 5 minutes to the address (apartment, office) or by geolocation (any point in the park, in the car in the parking lot) within the service area. Order your favorite drink without queuing, pay online, monitor the status of the order, and wait for the fast CUPCUP courier. We will even deliver a bagel! In the preparation of beverages, we use only the best specialty coffee, natural leaf, herbal teas from many countries (China, Japan, Sri Lanka, Germany, Ukraine, Thailand), first-class matcha, organic and alternative milk. Each menu item has a corresponding description (volume, energy value, cooking method, grain roaster, etc.). In some positions, this information is also available in short video format. All coffee shop workers have medical records, are vaccinated, and wear gloves and masks. Carefully follow the rules of hygiene and cleanliness in the kitchen. We sincerely want to make consumption in the "go" format as comfortable as possible and not take up your time. Do not be distracted from life! After installing the application, you will be able to: see the current menu of the nearest CUPCUP cafe; make an order, indicating your wishes (for example, drink coffee only on oat milk); pay for orders online; choose the method of receiving the order (delivery to the address or by geolocation); monitor the time of preparation and delivery; leave tips for barista and courier; receive notifications about promotions, new menu items, personal offers; learn more about how to brew coffee, prepare your favorite drinks, where you grow raw materials, what properties the drink has and much more.
name: CUPCUP

description:
At Merit, we take responsibility for the quality of coffee in your cup very seriously. This drove us to start sourcing and roasting our coffee 7 years ago. Our team travels to Central/South America and Africa to find the best quality coffee and work directly with the farmers. The coffee gets shipped to Texas, where it is roasted on a 45 & 25kg Probat roaster custom built for us in Germany. We create beautiful community spaces where you can enjoy that coffee, get some work done, connect with friends, or even escape the busyness of life. Our cafes focus on the local community and neighborhoods they are in.

With sourcing and roasting done, the next step is brewing. Our baristas are excellent and approachable coffee professionals who love learning names, remembering your drink order, and finding out how that job interview went last week – all while crafting a delicious cup of coffee we sourced, roasted, and brewed for you. Put simply; our mission is to be a light in our community, a bright spot in someone’s day.
name: Merit Coffee Co.

description:
Lavazza-België / Bluespresso België B.V. is exclusief leverancier van Lavazza (BLUE & Espresso) en distributeur van WEGA espressomachines voor de Nederlandse en Belgische horecamarkt. Met deze twee A-merken biedt Bluespresso absolute topkwaliteit koffie en koffieconcepten alsmede hoogwaardige en innovatieve espressomachines. Met deze combinatie bieden wij het perfecte totaalpakket voor de invulling van de optimale koffievoorziening in elke horecaonderneming. 

Naast een breed assortiment aan perfecte bonen melanges biedt Lavazza ook verschillende koffiecapsule concepten. Hiermee voorziet Lavazza de groeiende vraag naar gebruiksgemak waarbij de kwaliteit constant blijft. Met deze concepten, speciaal voor de horeca, thuismarkt en zakelijke markt ontwikkeld, kan iedereen de perfecte kop koffie zetten.

Trainingcentra:
Voor haar klanten heeft Bluespresso op meerdere locaties officiële Lavazza Trainingcentra geopend. Op deze speciale locaties leren uw medewerkers onder andere de perfecte espresso en cappuccino te bereiden. Daarnaast worden zij door onze barista's op de hoogte gebracht van de nodige kennis over koffie in het algemeen, apparatuur & onderhoud en natuurlijk de laatste trends.
 
Lavazza:
Lavazza is opgericht door Luigi Lavazza (1859-1949), die als detailhandelaar koffie ging branden en verkopen. Tegenwoordig is Lavazza voornamelijk bekend als leverancier van espressokoffie. Het bedrijf is de grootste koffiebrander en marktleider in Italië en exporteert haar producten wereldwijd. Internationaal wordt Lavazza erkend om haar hoge kwaliteit producten en hun innovatieve accessoires om uw horecagelegenheid aantrekkelijker en functioneler te maken. De experts van Lavazza selecteren alleen topkwaliteit en bieden een breed assortiment aan melanges met verschillende samenstellingen. Zo biedt Lavazza melanges van 100% Arabica-bonen en melanges van Arabica-bonen aangevuld met Robusta-bonen, waarbij de Robusta-bonen zorgen voor extra karakter.
name: Lavazza-België

description:
Metro Market is a pioneer in urban shopping for Milwaukee’s downtown residents. Roundy’s opened its first Metro Market store in 2004 primarily to serve downtown Milwaukee apartment and condominium residents. A second Metro Market was opened in 2010 in Brookfield, followed by a store in Mequon in 2011.

The Madison store will be the company’s fourth Metro Market  scheduled to open June 2014 while a fifth is scheduled to open in the Milwaukee suburb of Shorewood in 2015. 

Here at Metro Market, we are committed to living up to the lives of our customers by understanding their needs and delivering remarkable products and service. Our Metro Markets are extraordinary stores known for quality selection, unequaled hospitality and personal service. Customers love our expansive selections of fresh produce, meat, seafood, baked goods and prepared foods and exceptional specialty areas like our full-service coffee bar, sweet shop, homemade Italian gelato and our wine and cheese shop with more than 900 wines from all regions and imported, domestic and artisan cheeses. Our newest Metro Market adds a juice bar, spice shop, sushi bar and our famous Todd’s BBQ to make the shopping experience even more remarkable.

At Metro Market, we value the contributions of each of our employees and encourage them to grow within the company. With new stores in new markets, new opportunities for career advancement have never been greater which is good news for up-and-coming managers.
name: Metro Market

description:
Since 1983, Lake Champlain Chocolates has worked in pursuit of extraordinary chocolate moments. As a pioneer in the American chocolate movement, the Vermont chocolate company strives to create only the best-tasting chocolates imaginable. In the early days this meant sourcing the highest-quality fresh, local ingredients and never using preservatives or artificial flavors.

Today, the second-generation, family-owned company’s pursuit of the extraordinary continues. As a Certified B Corporation, the company is committed not only to be the best in the world, but to be the best for the world by supporting cacao growing communities and using 100% fair trade certified chocolate, reducing toxins in the environment by sourcing organic ingredients, whenever possible, and continuing to make extraordinary seasonal and everyday chocolates for all to enjoy.

Lake Champlain Chocolates are available at their three company-owned stores in Vermont, nationwide at specialty stores and grocers, and online at Amazon and www.lakechamplainchocolates.com.

description:
In Germany, Poggenpohl was founded in 1892 by Friedemir Poggenpohl. Friedemir had a vision to "improve the kitchen."​ Poggenpohl is the oldest and best-known kitchen brand in the world. 

Since 2012 Poggenpohl Kitchens Hawaii is the authorized distributor serving all the Hawaiian Islands. We are able to design and sell our kitchens in most locations around the world.

For 130 years, Poggenpohl has been reinventing life in the kitchen one idea at a time. Poggenpohl was the first to introduce many transformational innovations including the kitchen island, white lacquer furniture, and ergonomic work-top heights. 

Technical expertise, materials of unsurpassed quality, craftsmanship and trend-setting design go into each Poggenpohl kitchen. We focus on the utmost attention to detail. We never compromise on perfection. The design of each Poggenpohl kitchen is customized for each client and space. No two are alike, nor should they be. Projects are client-centric. Projects are designed and installed by trained professionals. Support is prompt and thorough, for decades. This is what we at Poggenpohl Kitchens Hawaii promise. 

Today's kitchens tend to be the focal point of a home and the central social gathering area. Sometimes the kitchen is meant to disappear. Whatever the desire, Poggenpohl Kitchens Hawaii aims to please and with the best custom solutions. Why would you settle for anything less?
name: Poggenpohl Kitchens Hawaii

Driven by the enthusiasm to satisfy the ever-growing demand for high quality documentary films and videos in Ethiopia, we joined the audiovisual industry in the country with the aim to deliver the highest quality video services that meet the interests of governmental, non-governmental, intergovernmental, bilateral and private organizations. Climax Studio is exclusively dedicated itself to producing various audiovisual products with specialization to documentary filmmaking. Over the last 13 years of its experience in the industry, Climax Studio has produced over 280 documentary films that addressed several pressing development agendas in Ethiopia and beyond. description:
Founded in 2011, Booskerdoo Coffee & Baking Co. is a coffee roastery and bakery franchise concept headquartered in beautiful Asbury Park, NJ. With stores in NJ and NY, Booskerdoo is currently expanding along the East Coast. 

Booskerdoo is the only coffee/bakery franchise that roasts its coffee in front of the customer, creating a retail experience that stimulates all five senses. All coffee sold is roasted within the week, helping to create the most delicious coffee on planet earth (a bold statement, we know). 

You can expect three things when you walk into one of our cafes: 1) Extraordinary coffee roasted on the retail floor and brewed with reverse osmosis filtered water on the industry's best drip and espresso equipment. 2) An exceptional food menu including a spread of pastries baked in-house each morning. 3) An inclusive culture founded on the simple idea of making people happy.

Simply put, coffee roasted in the last few days tastes way better than the months-old beans everyone else sells. Add the experience of seeing and smelling your coffee get roasted, and that makes it taste even more delicious. Literally... it’s called sensation transference. Our in-house bakery has the same effect. The aroma sets the tone, the fresh products blow minds, and strong inventory control creates a beautiful business dynamic. 

It’s a wonderful time to be in the specialty coffee business. Our consumer base is bigger than ever and still growing. With so much bad coffee out there, now is the time to secure a foothold as the premier retail coffee experience in your area. Reach out if you're interested in discussing a Booskerdoo franchise in your community. 

Cheers,
Team Boosk
name: Booskerdoo Coffee & Baking Co.

description:
Duverger is an Artisan macarons manufacturer based in Southern California.

These famous French treats are handcrafted everyday with love and the best possible ingredients.
No need to mention that everything is made with no preservatives, no artificial colors or flavors and no compounds.
They are also gluten free certified!

For Duverger, macarons are an art and French Chef Claire Becker created the perfect combination of texture, appearance and flavor to bring the American consumers the same experience they would find in Paris.

The adventure started in 2010 out of an LA neighborhood bakery in which they would bake at night and sell at Farmer’s markets during the day. 
Today, Duverger owns a state of the art production facility and is distributed in major natural retail chains & bakeries throughout the United States.
name: Duverger Macarons

description:
Schlotzsky’s® is a fast-casual restaurant franchise that started in 1971 and is home to The Original® oven-baked sandwich. The brand started in Austin, Texas and the made-to-order menu options still include bold flavors and fresh ingredients inspired by the food scene in Austin. Over 320 restaurants are serving delicious hot sandwiches on sourdough buns baked from scratch each day, specialty pizzas and fresh salads. Plus, many locations offer warm, oven-baked Cinnabon cinnamon rolls. Check us out online at www.schlotzskys.com to find a store near you.  Connect with us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. 

Schlotzsky’s® is a part of the Focus Brands® family of brands. Focus Brands®, through its affiliate brands, is the franchisor and operator of more than 6,600 restaurants, cafes, ice cream shoppes, and bakeries in all 50 states and over 60 countries and territories under the Auntie Anne’s®, Carvel®, Cinnabon®, Jamba®, Moe’s Southwest Grill®, McAlister’s Deli®, and Schlotzsky’s® brand names, as well as the Seattle’s Best Coffee® brand on certain military bases and in certain international markets. Please visit www.focusbrands.com to learn more.

With 13 years of tea industry expertise under its sleeve, SAVA is one of the trusted F&B service provider of luxury and premium hotels like JW Marriott, Kempinski, Sheraton and Intercontinental Group. Sava expands its portfolio of satisfied clients through the elite group of Restaurant Chains and Cafes from Meraas Group. 

SAVA came to prominence with the market introduction of Tchaba Designer Tea. Tchaba is  an exquisite premium range of full leaf teas handcrafted and blended with high grade natural ingredients and pure essential oils. To learn more, visit www.tchaba-arabia.com   

Today, five other unique brands make up the SAVA brand house, each of which SAVA has fully or partially contributed to its development.
 
Amir- a premium Halal grape juice from the heart of cape highlands in South Africa

Kahva – Pre-packed catering pouches and available in Turkish, Emirati and Saudi Coffee variants. Kahva will also feature individual serving packs that offer an all in-one means to brew freshly ground, high quality, 100% Arabica coffee beans

Arura- Teawares represents signature tea accessories with an array of creatively designed mouth blown glass ware and double walled tea cups. 

Arura Eco Tea – Arura Eco Teas is the first eco-friendly line of tea that uses sustainable packaging while offering the purest, full leaf teas.

Whether that means providing everyday competitive pricing, express shipping coffee samples, providing instant freight quotes and ETA's, offering a variety of payment options or efficiently resolving issues on the spot, ICT is doing it.

In every interaction with us we want you to experience a confidence and peace of mind that someone cares as much as you do about getting it right in things both big and small.

At ICT, customer care is everyone's job.

description:
We’re goodboybob, and we’re on a journey. 
 
To offer extraordinary coffee, the best you’ll find, anywhere. And serve it in surroundings that will inspire.
 
First, a clarification. We not only offer, but believe in extraordinary coffee – smooth, full-bodied, aromatically divine. Never sour or bitter. Even a little sweet, depending on the bean.
 
Each sip is a revelation to the uninitiated, a warm embrace to the connoisseur. With the power to create conversation, launch a masterpiece, spark romance, change the arc of history. 
 
We begin by working with our network of artisanal growers and importers, securing the most unique and interesting coffee beans in the world, at times so rare we’re the only ones in the entire country to have them.
 
In the few short years we’ve been around, our rare and exclusive coffees have developed quite a following, including our growing community of loyal subscribers. These discerning coffee lovers have our limited coffee roasts (and subsequently our artful coffee experience), shipped directly to their doorstep, as far away as, and this even surprised us, Dubai.
 
As we said, it’s extraordinary coffee.
 
Going a step further, we do our own roasting right here in LA, which may sound obsessive, but to us, it’s another critical step to ensure that we can control the quality, and taste, of our coffee.
 
The culmination of all of these efforts, the brewing of our coffee, is overseen by our dedicated and passionate staff, with a meticulous eye for detail. Nothing is overlooked. No shortcuts are taken.

To state the obvious, coffee this extraordinary can’t be served someplace, well, ordinary.
 
Each goodboybob reflects our love of art, design, craft, and visual expression. Walk in and you’ll immediately feel the creative-inspired details.

We’re goodboybob. We invite you to stop by one of our locations. Or order a bag of our extraordinary coffee online. And join us on our journey.
name: goodboybob

description:
Our Passion and Vision

Terra Coffee and Tea represents the culmination of years of hard work and commitment by Carlo Granito, a humanist and entrepreneur who’s passionate about coffee. As a philanthropist who puts quality first, Carlo has worked with his team to develop a remarkable approach that enables them to bring the world’s best coffees to the Canadian and international markets.

Motivated by a concern for the inequalities faced by coffee farmers, he follows a golden rule when purchasing green coffee beans. After an extremely meticulous search and selection process that can take up to 10 years, he generally offers above-market prices (up to 80% higher) so that farmers, their families and their communities have the means to improve their living conditions. 

This unique approach to helping others has allowed Carlo to establish close relationships with these mountain-dwelling families who, in return, are pleased to offer him their best products. The farmers understand that it’s not in their best interest to sell their high quality coffee beans to large brokers who offer much lower prices. 

Despite the growth of his business, Carlo has chosen to preserve the traditional art of coffee roasting in order to guarantee freshness. He prefers to rely on the skills of Terra’s roastmasters   rather than use automated production equipment .

He will continue to promote the values of quality, generosity and respect exemplified by his role as a model corporate citizen.
name: Terra Coffee and Tea Ltd

description:
Like the tireless hummingbird searching for sweet nectar, Blue Hummingbird Coffee relentlessly pursues the highest quality, single origin, micro lot, and specialty coffee to bring to your table. 

UNIQUE COFFEE

Blue hummingbirds are in constant pursuit of sweet nectar. Inspired by these busy birds, our team at Blue Hummingbird diligently seeks out unique and flavorful beans to bring you a premium selection of specialty micro lot coffees. We source our beans from single origin sources or estates, and often trade directly with farmers.

PREMIUM QUALITY

We treasure good coffee. That’s why our beans are subject to rigorous quality control, from hand picking our lots to premium roasting and packaging processes. Our mission is to deliver the full potential of beans so you can brew coffee worth savoring.

SUSTAINABLE ROOTS

We take pride in selecting beans that are ethically-sourced and grown. Farmers are rewarded for their quality and how they care for the environment. Here at Blue Hummingbird, we ensure that all farmers we source our beans from participate in sustainable practices that lead to ethical business models and environmentally-friendly farming methods. This allows all parties to continually improve coffee quality, farm productivity, and crop yield.
name: Blue Hummingbird Coffee

description:
Touton is a leading agro-industrial actor. Our know-how builds on over 150 years’ experience of providing our customers with high quality commodities and services.

In addition to delivering responsibly sourced cocoa, coffee, vanilla, and natural ingredients, we are now increasing our engagement in commodity-producing countries through processing operations in cocoa. With subsidiaries in originating regions, and agents in key locations, Touton’s strength lies in the skills of its workers, the cultural diversity of its teams, and a deep understanding of the countries in which the company operates.

Dedicated to upholding its shareholders' commitment to sustainability, Touton builds on its strong footing in the countries that produce the commodities it trades and processes, to pioneer inclusive programmes that address the needs of stakeholders all along the supply-chain.

Touton partners with actors from the public, private and civil society sectors to develop innovative projects that support the business-case for sustainable commodity production. By doing so, Touton contributes to the preservation of resources for future generations and to reinforcing individual and institutional capacities of the stakeholders it engages with.
name: Touton SA

We are a Specialty Coffee Importer, Roaster and Cafe.

We use this philosophy to continually build and strengthen relationships with coffee farmers and their families all over the world. These relationships allow us to provide high end specialty coffee directly from their farms to your cup.

Our dedication to quality and service is fueled by our commitment to customer satisfaction, a fervent caffeine addiction, and ongoing research. In fact, we perform extensive research on every batch of coffee beans that we import in order to provide you with the highest quality product.

description:
Born in 1999, Anodyne Coffee Roasting Company is a locally owned, small batch roaster proudly working in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Our coffee is roasted, packaged, and delivered daily by our dedicated team of passionate roasters. We don’t pre-package any of our coffee. Each bag is labeled and filled for each individual order. We aim to deliver fast turnaround times and low shipping minimums to ensure fresh coffee when you need it. It is this dedication that allows us to provide an excellent cup of coffee using just enough technology and expertise to ensure consistent results and satisfaction with every roast, every time.

Though producing quality coffee is our first love, our passion extends beyond the mug. We roast on a Loring Smart Roaster which utilizes patented technology to reduce our energy consumption and green house gases by 80%. Whether it’s a farmer’s market, a fundraiser, or a coffee festival, you’ll find us being active in our community. We take pride in sourcing our beans from importers of the highest integrity and implementing a roasting style that aims to preserve the inherent and unique flavor characteristics of each coffee.

So brew yourself a cup and enjoy the coffee that cures.
name: Anodyne Coffee Roasting Co.

description:
Chris and Pattie Nachtrieb began Chris'​ Coffee Service in 1975. Chris was delivering coffee "kits"​ from his red El Camino while Pattie was handling calls and paperwork throughout the day. As they continued to grow locally, they employed several off-duty Colonie Police Officers to help with the coffee deliveries.

Fast-forward 41 years and 45 employees later, Chris'​ Coffee Service, Inc. is now nationally recognized as one of the largest importers of espresso machines in the country. Several of the machines we import were designed in collaboration with the manufacturer and Chris himself. Chris'​ Coffee Service is the exclusive importer of those machines and supplies more than 40 distributors through out the US and Canada. When Chris was having difficulty purchasing the quality of coffee he wanted to provide his customers he decided it was time to simply start roasting his own coffee. Fast-Forward again, Chris'​ Coffee Service is one of the largest coffee roasters in upstate N.Y., roasting more than 80,000 pounds per month. Premium gourmet coffees include, Fair Trade and USDA Certified Organic coffees as well. One of the few surviving family-owned local coffee Roaster service companies operating in the Capital District today.
name: Chris Coffee Service, Inc.

description: Since 1990, Organic Products Trading Company has been working directly with small-scale farmers around the world to source high quality green specialty coffee. Our business is built on long-term relationships with Certified Organic and Fair Trade co-operatives as well as conventional farms that focus on improving their communities, their families, and their environment. OPTCO's mission is to support coffee producers by providing market access, in addition to collaborating on development projects, gender equality initiatives, harvest finance, and quality improvement programs. Join the effort to support coffee communities by sourcing your certified and conventional beans with OPTCO. We believe that family is important and “Organic” is more than a trend. We believe that farmers should earn fair wages and helping to build community should be part of every business. We believe coffee should always taste great and great coffee can be the vehicle to create a better world. As importers, we see first hand where coffee comes from and feel responsible for how that coffee arrives into the consumer market. For more than 20 years, we have been traveling to the remote mountain areas that produce the world’s best beans. Despite many changes within the coffee industry, we still feel it is vital to meet face to face with our suppliers. We visit farmers and share meals and cups of coffee in kitchens. We discuss the harvest with cooperatives, and talk about how to strengthen business in the coming years. Often, that means providing other forms of support such as market information, pre-finance loans, or collaborating on development programs in education, health, infrastructure, and technical assistance. OPTCO has been strengthening these relationships for over two decades and is proud to stand by its producer groups and share their coffee, and their stories with roasters and consumers around the world.
name: Organic Products Trading Company, LLC

description:
From the Islands with Love!

We want to help upmarket hotels and restaurants all across Florida and the Caribbean share that same welcoming spirit. It’s why we’re crafting some of the very best, most delicious specialty coffees under the sun.

In beautiful Charlotte Amalie and South Florida, hospitality is second nature. We greet strangers with a smile, and new friends with a great cup of coffee. 

What makes our coffee so unusually enticing? The secret lies in our method of artisanal small batch roasting. Roasting our beans in smaller quantities leads to better quality control, and lets us capture flavors and aromas rarely found in mass produced coffees. It’s a difference you’re sure to notice—and so will your guests and customers.

Of course, our expertise goes well beyond the roastery. We specialize in serving the hospitality industry and know exactly what it takes to run an exceptional hot beverage program. Our partner hotels and restaurants turn to us for everything from custom menu development to equipment management to staff training and more.

You’ll find our small batch specialty coffees delighting guests and customers in some of the region’s most beloved and highly regarded establishments. We’d love to craft one for you. After all, what says “welcome” better than a truly great cup of coffee?
name: Virgin Islands Coffee Roasters

description:
Buying green coffee is very difficult for roasters. Importers' sites list the coffees in a hard to read spreadsheet, requiring lots of communication back and forth. This is prohibitively time consuming, so most roasters just buy from one importer, greatly limiting their selection.

By offering the coffee from many importers in one, easy to parse ecommerce site, we let roasters pick from a much wider selection of beans, and we save importers and roasters time by eliminating the back and forth. We also work directly with warehouses to simplify logistics and cut shipping costs. 

The number of microroasters is exploding, and with Beander they can compete with the bigger guys on both price and selection.
name: Beander

description:
The Falling Rock is a local, independently owned coffee shop, café and bookstore conveniently located in downtown Munising near the Lake Superior shoreline—a perfect location for both travelers and residents.

We work hard to provide a diverse selection of new and used books, along with a special section dedicated to local authors and regional lore. We have declared ourselves as one of the Upper Peninsula’s most unique bookstores, with over 30,000 titles in subjects ranging from Great Lakes shipwrecks and local Native American history, to New York Times Bestsellers and illustrated poetry books.

We found that our coffee is inherently what connects people to our café, so we created Great Lakes Coffee Company with the goal of bringing the finest, freshest coffees from around the world to our customers. We support fair trade and our green coffee beans are carefully selected from their countries of origin by specialty coffee importers and roasted fresh. Each batch of coffee is roasted by hand using an “Ambex” gas-fired, drum roaster at our facility in northern Michigan.
name: Falling Rock Cafe & Bookstore

description:
Tastify is an award-winning coffee cupping and database management app built for producers and exporters to green-buyers and home-roasters. We aspire to build a platform to fully streamline communication between producers and consumers in the coffee industry - and thus to facilitate more transparent and equitable coffee transactions. Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Mandarin (Simplified), Japanese, Korean and Bahasa.

Tastify allows a user to document the taste experience of a coffee in real time, in a visual-friendly way for easy reference in the future. The user then effectively notates a wide variety of different descriptors as they move through the cupping experience, and can add new descriptors along the way. As the user cups through different coffees, Tastify records each coffee in its database, and these data points can be brought up and referred to in a number of different manners. Tastify also comes with a guest user function where you can invite friends, clients or team members to join your cupping session for free.

Tastify also helps users to look for a particular flavor profile and can search their database by creating a custom set of flavor characteristics, and coffees that fit the profile they create will populate the screen. Furthermore, with a sufficient set of data points, our users could use this data as a powerful tool to communicate trends or comparison in quality and productivity to their partners at all chains in the industry, from farmers to roaster clients.

Finally, Tastify can help you generate visually engaging reports and coffee score graphs or spider-webs. It can be used for client marketing collaterals, product presentation or simply to communicate between team members.
name: Tastify
searchQueries: German coffee industry associations and organizations

description: Ninety Plus ® Coffee is a grower and producer of single-origin, single-variety coffee in both Panama and Ethiopia. We are dedicated to creating a remarkable taste experience through process innovation. At our core is a connection to nature, best social practices and working to fix a broken system through creating canopy and restoration ecology. We are stewards for taste committed to leaving coffee better than we found it.
name: Ninety Plus Coffee

description:
We're a single cafe and wholesale coffee roaster located in the up-and-coming Central Ninth district in Salt Lake City. Our passion has always been to roast extraordinary coffee and provide exceptional customer care both at our cafe and to our web/wholesale customers. Cultivating a community of coffee lovers (and people who just want to hang out) is a huge focus for us as well. 

In one form or another we've been around since 2006 and have always remained true to our craft: teaching people that coffee can always be better. Our cafe grew into a wholesale business in early 2013 and has grown to a local and national wholesale presence within coffee sales as well as equipment sales and maintenance. We currently have just under 15 employees between the two sides of the business.

As for our coffee itself, everything we buy is considered Specialty Grade by the Specialty Coffee Association standards and is sourced in a traceable manner from reputable importers and direct from farm whenever possible. Everything we roast is on the lighter side to highlight the delicate side of coffee - florals and high fruit flavors are most of what we seek in a cup of coffee.

In 2018 we launched an office coffee subscription program in an attempt to get better coffee into offices with the same level of education and care we've shown to the rest of our customers. We also designed a very simple ordering platform which lets you place a recurring order once and only worry about it if you need to modify an upcoming order.
name: Blue Copper Coffee

description:
The Gaviña family has been in the coffee business for over 150 years as growers, importers, and roasters of gourmet coffee. The most important word in this statement is family. A strong sense of family is at the heart of F. Gaviña & Sons, Inc., more commonly known as Gaviña. The Company, one of the largest and most successful coffee businesses in the western United States, is led by a team of four siblings: three brothers, Jose, Pedro and Paco, and one sister, Leonor Gaviña-Valls. We have been US specialty coffee roasters since 1967 and we are the largest privately held minority coffee roaster nationwide, producing more than 30 million pounds of roasted coffee a year. The installation of our new state-of-the-art roasting and packing facility is almost complete, with a capacity of 60 million pounds and expandable to 100 million pounds. Our leading specialty retail brands include:

description:
Reily Foods is a 5th-generation, family-owned company that provides the wholesome and authentic foods and beverages that create meals and memories that bring together family and friends.
Since 1902, we’ve helped to define the true food and beverage flavors of the South. We’re proud of our New Orleans heritage – it continues to shape the way we make our products and the way we believe in doing business. Our commitment to quality is more than a corporate promise – it’s a Reily family tradition.
Prior to the turn of the 20th century, William B. Reily operates a wholesale grocery business in Monroe, Louisiana. With his expertise in roasting and the strong demand for his coffees, Mr. Reily moves to New Orleans and founds a company to roast, grind, package and distribute canned coffee. It is the birth of the Luzianne® brand.
Mr. Reily is joined by Jacob Aron, an importer of green coffee. With 85% of all imported coffee beans passing through New Orleans, they assure themselves of having the first choice of the finest beans available. As the company’s reputation for quality grows, tea is added to the product line.
Mr. Reily develops the first tea ever specially blended for pouring over ice. Luzianne® helps popularize iced tea as a cool way to beat the Southern heat, and its reputation for clear, smooth-tasting, refreshing iced tea is soon established across the South.
Reily Foods Company continues to manufacture and market the highest quality coffee and tea brands as well as mayonnaise, cake flour, sauces, chili seasonings, salad dressings, and brownie mixes throughout the U.S. and, for select products, internationally. The consumer demand for Reily Foods Company products reflects the impressive loyalty of our customers and continues to drive our company’s growth.
name: Wm. B. Reily & Co., Inc.

description:
Tavalon is an online tea company (www.tavalon.com) as well as a wholesaler of the world's best teas for retail outlets, specialty stores, cafes, restaurants and more.

Tavalon's goal is not only to create the best tea blends the world has ever known, but also to cater these tea blends to the American palate.	

Utilizing over 200 focus groups to ensure that we've created absolutely delicious, one-of-a-kind recipes that will fit your tastes, our Tea Sommelier Chris Cason selects and blends premium loose leaf teas from all over the world.

Music is a passion that Tavalon has always drawn inspiration from. Like tea, music is an age-old experience shared and enjoyed practically everywhere around the world. The ubiquitous power of music reinforces tavalon's conviction that we can create great teas - accessible not just to connoisseurs, but to those from all walks of life.

Music has manifested itself in virtually every aspect of the company, permeating though not only our approach, but through our teas which we call 'mixes', 'remixes', and 'the uncut.' Like the music from whose name it is taken, mixes are our completely original inventions. Remixes, like in music, are our interpretations of classics. The uncut is just pure, amazing tea.

Tea has played a minimal role for far too long in the United States, overshadowed by the seemingly ubiquitous coffee bean empire, and mired in its own "traditional" image. The goal of Tavalon is to push tea back into the spotlight by presenting a fresh, new, accessible face for tea-- Tavalon tea.

Our objective is to become a tea company for both tea connoisseurs and newcomers to the tea world. We aim to provide premium teas and accessories to a global audience.

description:
Originally, SCR was a marketing research project for a start-up roasters in Annan, Scotland. It was soon becoming clear that our profile and story was developing a following and everything roasted was sold every week!  We decided to make it legal and officially open as a coffee roaster here in the US, still keeping our plans to open in Scotland when the door opens. We're dedicated to NOT burning our beans. Rather, we bring out the best flavors our origins have to offer. Not only do we offer our products in whole-bean or ground, we also offer pods. Our pods contain a barista-dose of 14g of fresh coffee. Most national brands only pack 6-10g and it's nowhere close to being fresh. We grind and pack our pods the same day. Each pod has a valve to allow the CO2 to escape without allowing oxygen to get in. We call these "Super Pods" and they're well worth it!  

We're not coffee snobs. We encourage everyone to "Drink the Coffee YOU Like!"  Add cream, add sugar, make it the way you like your drink. We believe that coffee is to be enjoyed and bless your day with a boost!  May you be blessed with every cup purchased, and every sip taken. *Orders in NW Arkansas have free delivery upon request.

description:
GOOD SPIRITS


OUR COFFEE BREWERY
Located in Germany’s bustling capital Berlin we have established our own coffee brewery. This is where we work to redefine the coffee experience for the 21st century.

Using innovative brewing methods we unlock coffee’s full potential:
	• Pure and honest taste
	• No added sugar or additives
	• Organic certified ingredients

For our ready-to-drink cold brew coffee we use only filtered water and organic certified coffee beans. A careful light roast gives our coffee its wonderful aroma. A hint of fruit, a full load of chocolate!


OUR  MISSION
Coffee is part of our everyday, but is harvested only once a year. While it can be consumed at every street corner, it needs to be shipped from exotic far away places around the equator. Often reduced to only a small part of a large milk beverage, coffee when rightly treated has more aromas than wine. Coffee is truly special. This is why we produce a specialty coffee beverage that can be enjoyed in its purest form.

Our green coffees are carefully selected, then precisely roasted to their full potential, professionally brewed by us and finally neatly packaged. Connecting the origin and the consumer, giving coffee the elegance and appreciation it deserves.


COLD BREW FOR YOU
We also produce cold brew for roasteries and brands within Germany and Europe.

description:
Landwer Coffee is one of Israel's leading coffee company. 
Manufacturer, distributer, importer and exporter of Turkish and Espresso coffee. 

In 1919 Moshe Landwer opened a small coffee bar in the center of Berlin that quickly became a popular meeting place. In addition to the coffee bar, the family also operated a small coffee roasting facility. 
In 1933 when the Nazis came to power in Germany, the family decided to immigrate to Israel. Immediately after their arrival to Tel-Aviv, the Landwer family opened their first coffee roasting plant in the famous Alenbi Street. Later, when the business expanded, the family moved the coffee bar to 123 Alenbi Street.

In the 40's and 50's "Landwer Coffee" became the most popular brand in Israel. During the strict austerity times of the 50's, when the Finance Minister, Mr. Dov Yosef, encouraged cheap replacement Items like "Chicory", Landwer kept selling its high quality, real coffee blends. 
In view of the growing demand, in 1964 the production facilities were moved again and this time to the industrial zone of Holon, where it is still located today utilizing about 1000 square Meter. 

In the early 80's, the Federman family acquired Landwer Coffee.

The company is continuing a conservative and strict quality control policy. Well aware of the challenges of the 21st century, the firm responded vigorously in recent years by investing in new production lines, rebranding and expanding distribution to new geographic areas.
name: Landwer Coffee

description:
Roasting coffee is as much art as science. We began roasting a few years ago, roasting and burning through air poppers, but gaining the ear and nose for a perfect roast. After continual tweaks and hacks, we invested in a small home roaster and began roasting coffee for family and friends. They encouraged us to produce our coffee commercially. We use a 1kg fluid bed and computer controlled roaster for consistency and quality. Each roast is carefully tracked and monitored by temperature, with attention to the best flavor development for the particular coffee.

We roast on-demand, usually on Mondays and Fridays. Coffee is shipped USPS and arrives on your doorstep at the beginning of its peak flavor. By comparison, your local coffee chain’s coffee has an expiration of 6 months from its roasting. Even the costly boutique coffee will typically be weeks to months old.

If haven’t tasted a micro-roast yet, the proof will be in your cup. Every batch is unique, often seasonal, and always fearlessly roasted for you. Enjoy!
name: Coffee by Gillespie LLC

description:
The warm Pacific sun, rich volcanic earth, abundant mountain rain and cool trade winds of Kauai create ideal conditions for growing outstanding coffee.
 
Kauai Coffee Company is Hawaii’s largest coffee grower, and the largest grower in the United States, with over 4 million coffee trees grown on 3,100 acres. Kauai Coffee Company LLC, is part of Massimo Zanetti Beverage, USA, Inc., one of the nation’s largest coffee roasters, and is a subsidiary of the Italian global coffee company Massimo Zanetti Beverage Group.
 
Kauai Coffee Company is a true Hawaiian coffee estate. From growing the coffee to roasting and packaging it, we employ sustainable, environmentally sound practices throughout every step of the process here on our farm. Above all, we focus on assuring the highest quality and delivering our customers the consistency and excellence they desire.

The Kauai Coffee Company Visitor Center is open from 9:00 am-5:30 pm for the summer, seven days a week. Located on the westside of Kauai, on Highway 540 (for GPS directions, use 870 Haleweli Rd, Kalaheo). We have guided walking tours at 10a, 12p, 2p, and 4p (no reservations needed) plus self guided tour if the time isn't convenient, an informational video and all of the free coffee you can sample.

description: At the heart of the BW Blacksmith Coffee Company lies family. Anything and everything we do, we do together as a family here at BW. For years, we have been a DIY family. From building coffee tables to building homes, together, we have done it all. Our passion for working together, handcrafting quality products, and creating memories along the way was instilled in us by our grandpa, Bernard Camille Willems, or as he was known to those around him, Ben. Grandpa Ben was an incredible man in every sense of the word. He was a true craftsman who took deep pride in his work, possessed a desire to always go the extra mile, was firmly grounded (steady, unyielding?) in his faith, and had a true love for his family. He loved spending time working on projects together, sharing in the special memories and making sure the work days were never dull and full of silly moments! He was an avid collector of tools and parts from years gone by, especially pieces that reflect the working man’s history and early American grit and ingenuity. In his last few years, he became passionate about blacksmithing and even built a working blacksmith shop that was his pride and joy. Unfortunately, he passed away before being able to really start working on his blacksmith projects after being diagnosed with cancer. His passing has driven us to carry on his legacy, share with others all of the values he so diligently impressed upon us, and given us a desire (eagerness, commitment?) to lend a helping hand to those fighting cancer and their families. Thus, BW Blacksmith Coffee Co. was born. A percentage of all proceeds go directly to victims of cancer and their families to help them defeat this terrible disease. In his memory, we turned B.W. Blacksmith into a brand to allow his enthusiasm for hard work, family, friends, and faith in God to live on.
name: BW Blacksmith Coffee Co

description: We’ve been crafting the finest quality coffee for almost 50 years. From our carefully roasted signature blend—chosen after the Costa brothers blind-tested 112 variations—to our iconic Flat White and many other options. We are proud of Costa’s premium coffee offering. After the first sip, you’ll see why Costa is the perfect cup, every time.
name: Costa Coffee US

description:
HOW CAN WE HELP YOU?
Our mission is a blend of different ingredients – specially crafted to empower you to identify what you truly need to be happy and what you want to be fulfilled. Through a special mixture of goal-setting, we help navigate you in your journey to success by utilizing the Enneagram system, Agile methodology, and data analytics. We believe that by understanding how you think, how you feel, and how you behave….your relationships (old & new) will be enhanced, thus enabling you to become both professionally satisfied and personally fulfilled – in other words: to be happy & feel successful.

WHY COFFEE? WHY PAIR COFFEE WITH COACHING & CONSULTING?
Indeed a very unusual combination. Our founder, Linda Brewster, has a lifelong passion for coffee. Even before Linda fell in love with strategic planning & leadership development while earning her MBA in Finance, she loved coffee. Her grandparents owned a bakery/coffeeshop and her earliest childhood memories are around the kitchen table with family drinking coffee, and Linda was awestruck by a few things about coffee:

How coffee brings people together locally to share much-needed breaks from our increasingly frenetic lifestyles.
That coffee is global – lets us touch people from around the Earth. The World Bank estimates that coffee is the largest employer on the planet, with 500 million people directly or indirectly involved in the coffee trade.
Caffeine makes people (and goats) have energy to think clearly and to “get things done!”
Most people don’t understand specialty coffee or how to brew better coffee – and how this will not only enhance their coffee experience and relationship, but also improve the livelihood of millions in developing countries.


So, again, why Coffee? No other reason than our founder, Linda, loves coffee and truly believes that her extraordinary homegrown recipe can help us help you, your family, your friends, your company, and your community.
name: My Coffee Coach

description:
AC Horn Manufacturing - BUILT TO LAST

It all started in a modest garage in Texas in 1907. Yet it wasn’t until 1946, when a young A.C. “Ace” Horn took over his father’s small sheet metal operation, that the company we know today began to take shape. Ace didn’t know what would become of his new enterprise, but he did know how he wanted things done. He believed that a business, like any person, was only as good as its word. So, he set out to build a company he could be proud of––one that offered genuine quality, delivered on its promises and stood by its work.

All these years later, Horn has evolved into a worldwide leader in processing equipment for the snack food industry. There’s no denying times have changed, but Ace’s guiding principles are as relevant today as ever.

Savvy food processors have come to know Horn for integrity in everything we do. Unsurprisingly, it starts with the equipment we build. Each piece is made with the kind of good, honest craftsmanship that’s just not found in competitive products. We use only the very best parts, the most carefully thought out design, and we never take shortcuts. It’s what makes our equipment the most reliable––and trusted––in the industry.

Today, the Horn product line features best-in-class nut roasters and popcorn poppers, plus top-quality equipment for milling, peanut blanching and the packaging room. We offer capabilities to customize certain machines and boast a well-respected, highly efficient job shop center. It all combines to make Horn an invaluable partner for snack food producers around the globe.

Smaller manufacturers depend on us. Some of the world’s largest corporations do too.

It’s safe to say Ace would be proud of what his company has become. One built on integrity whose values always shine through. We’ll keep striving to craft the best machinery around, following through on our commitment to our customers, and going above and beyond to earn their trust.
name: AC Horn Manufacturing

description:
SEDA Solubles SL is an instant coffee manufacturer for the private label established in 1963 and based in Northern Spain in the city of Palencia. More than 70% of our production is already exported to markets such as the UK, France, Portugal, Germany, Turkey, Russia, USA and other countries in Eastern Europe and Southeastern Asia. 

SEDA obtained the ISO9000/2000 (IQNet), Kosher certificate, Tesco and BRC certifications and is committed to the AFCASOLE rules (European Association of Instant Coffee Manufacturers). We are producers of instant coffee and carry out the whole process in our plant: selection and import of green beans, roasting, extraction, concentration, spray drying, agglomeration and packaging. Besides, we also produce freeze dried coffee (lyophilisation) and additional processing such as aromatisation and decaffeination. 

SEDA carries out the whole process of production of instant coffee and we are in the position to develop specific blends to meet different market requirements. We have our own laboratory and internal panel of tasters. The total capacity of the company of spray, agglomerated and freeze dried coffee is around 16.000 tons annually, plus 10.000tons of decaffeination. We offer the following packaging:

•	Glass and PET jars of 50, 100, 200 grams 
•	Sachets and sticks of 2 grams in boxes of 10, 25, 50 and 100 units 
•	Pouches of 250, 500 and 1,000 grams
•	Tins of 100, 200 and 250 grams
•	Bulk: 20kgs and big bags of 300kg

description:
Food security is a human right, yet hunger and malnutrition persist in many countries that produce agricultural commodities for global markets. Approximately 80 percent of people facing hunger live in rural areas of the Global South and often work in the agricultural sector—including smallholders, farmers and landless labourers (Global Hunger Index 2022). 

The Food Security Standard (FSS) aims to support the private sector's effort to improve social sustainability and end hunger for farmers, workers and neighbouring communities. It seeks to realize the right to adequate food through the responsible production and global trade of agricultural commodities. The FSS complements existing sustainability standards by providing a holistic approach to the human right to food through a practical toolbox and measurable criteria designed to be applied to all agricultural products, farm sizes and business forms. 

The FSS was developed in 2017 as a cooperation of the Center for Development Research (University of Bonn, Germany) and the NGOs Welthungerhilfe (Bonn, Germany) and WWF (Berlin, Germany). It is funded by the German Federal Ministry for Food and Agriculture (BMEL) via the agency "Fachagentur Nachwachsende Rohstoffe". The Standard is now actively managed by MEO Carbon Solutions and Deutsche Welthungerhilfe e.V. Together, they want to anchor the right to adequate food in sustainability certifications.
name: Food Security Standard

description:
Giesen Coffee Roasters is the producer of high-quality coffee roasters that excel in quality, appearance and functionalities. Because of our high level of quality and the constant availability of our support team Giesen Coffee Roasters is one of the top brands of coffee roasters.

Family company with 30 years of experience
Giesen Coffee Roasters is a family company that started as a metal business 30 years ago where the parts of various machines were produced, including parts of coffee roasters. As time passed and the technical knowledge increased, Wilfred Giesen decided to change direction in 2006 and focused exclusively on the production of high quality coffee roasters.

No nonsense mentality
Although Giesen Coffee Roasters is a well known brand name and we have a worldwide distributor network, our mentality remains informal and we maintain our no-nonsense approach. Our focus lies on producing high quality coffee roasters and our customer’s satisfaction. No more and certainly no less. We work hard to achieve these ends, aiming for quality and always ready to offer our clients the best service we can provide.
name: Giesen Coffee Roasters

description:
Santos & Knafla is a German-Portuguese coffee manufacturer with its headquarters in a former roasters in Coimbra, Portugal.
We had the great opportunity to take over the well maintained roasting facilities as well as some “ancient” machinery, where coffee was roasted over an open wood fire. This is a kind of museum and gives you an idea about what coffee roasting was like in former days.
So, we are also happy to have a new gas fired drum roaster and the hygienic conditions in the actual roasting facility. The standard procedures from HACCP (Hazard Analysis und Critical Control Point) helps us to maintain the high requirements in production of coffee.

In Santos & Knafla we agreed to keep up the old tradition of slow and careful roasting in drum roaster. Compared to industrial roasting with high amounts of beans roasted in a few minutes we take our time. The roasting takes about 20 minutes and our roast master has been roasting coffee for 42 years. He is a real expert, checking the roasting grade every few moments prior to the end of the roasting. The smell, the “cracking” sound of the beans and his knowledge of the origins of the beans enables him to perform a perfect roast on the individual blends.
With such opportunities, we decided to get involved in the fantastic world of coffee roasting.

The idea behind our young company Santos & Knafla is to maintain the traditional way of Portuguese Coffee Culture and add some modern influences.
This is already expressed in the different packages. Having a Retro-look in the Café Santos blends and a fresh, modern appearance in the Santos & Knafla Coffees.
The philosophy of Santos & Knafla is to produce a fresh coffee as it is known in Portugal and other south Mediterranean parts of different countries. This means strong body and great crema on the espresso without any additives and a manifold of aromas.
A high quality coffee for a reasonable price!
name: Santos & Knafla Traditional Coffee Roasters

description:
Andytown Coffee Roasters was founded in 2014 by Michael McCrory and Lauren Crabbe to bring specialty coffee roasting to the Outer Sunset in San Francisco. 

We wanted Andytown to feel like your grandmother's kitchen—clean, cozy, welcoming, and warm. When we started, we did all our roasting, baking, and customer service in our 600 square foot space. 

In 2017, we expanded onto Taraval with a new cafe right next to the beach and a brand new roasting facility. When we moved the roasting out of our Lawton cafe, we were able to remodel the kitchen and expand our bakery to provide pastries for all locations. We now have three locations in the Outer Sunset and one location downtown.

As we grow, we are building a team of experienced coffee and pastry professionals who work hard and continuously challenge us to improve.

We believe in investing in our neighborhood, creating good jobs, and using our economic impact for good.

Andytown is built on a foundation of quality, approachability, and transparency. We are constantly working to improve ourselves, our product, and the world in which we live.
name: Andytown Coffee Roasters

Our coffees are ethically sourced from around the world and roasted in small batches on-premise.

description:
Before roasting coffee in Hawaiʻi, our Roaster was a Fire Fighter in New York's FDNY. Every firehouse started the tour with the same Tradition, enjoying a cup of coffee at the kitchen table while talking, listening and sharing. Hawaiʻi also has many great Traditions to respect and love. One of our favorites is “talking story,” an extended moment where we talk, listen and share. Coffee is our way of bringing the world a little closer together. When Tradition is shared, we learn that we have more in common with each other than differences. There is New York Tradition in every cup and Aloha in every sip. 

We globally source the highest quality, specialty-grade coffee beans available throughout the world. We then roast the beans in a fire heated drum, drawing out the exquisite flavors hidden within each bean. As a family owned business, our coffee selections continually reach deeper than flavor, focusing on farmers who match our dedication towards sustainability, organic agriculture and fair-trade.
name: Tradition Coffee Roasters

description:
Portland Coffee Roasters mission is to brew the perfect cup of coffee while maintaining a commitment to sustainability from bean to cup, not only in our community but in the communities where we source our high-quality coffee beans. Our employees are genuine coffee experts and aficionados who dedicate themselves to serve our customers and maintain thriving relationships with our trusted farmers throughout the world. When you enjoy a cup of Portland Coffee Roasters, you join the mission to improve international coffee growing regions.

Since 2008, we have maintained carbon neutral operations. Portland Coffee Roasters is dedicated to cutting down on waste with many initiatives, including but not limited to:

- Composting organic waste – up to 1,000 pounds per month
- Selling our wholesale coffee in compostable bags
- Using recycled paper throughout our offices – 80% for office use and 100% post-consumer recycled shipping packaging
- Offering employee incentives for biking to work

We continually track and publish a yearly Sustainability Report so that you can learn about our efforts. For more information, please visit our website.
name: Portland Coffee Roasters

It is our goal to create a product and atmosphere that will elevate your day and help you be your best self.

description:
Broadsheet Coffee Roasters was founded in July 2017 and is located right behind Harvard Yard in Cambridge, MA. We are Cambridge’s first (and only) specialty coffee roastery. Our name comes from the paper that the nearby Harvard Printing Press published as a way to spread meaningful news and cheer almost 400 years ago. 

We are committed to showcasing the very best in conscientiously-sourced coffees. We are at the cutting edge of roasting and extraction sciences and are always striving to improve. It is an ongoing process involving persistence, learning, and discipline; all in the hope that we can make world class coffee accessible to our community.

We continue to grow with a great team of people who strive to be students and participants in the coffee industry. Broadsheet Coffee Roasters joyfully pursues beautiful coffee: we hope to share that joy with you wherever you are on your coffee journey.
name: Broadsheet Coffee Roasters

description:
Alakef Coffee Roasters was born out of a passion for coffee and the search for the “perfect cup.” Alyza Bohbot is the second generation owner of Alakef, which was started by her parents in Duluth, MN in 1990. The name "Alakef “ comes from an Israeli slang term meaning “hits the spot” or “the best.” Alakef is dedicated to providing customers with only the highest quality coffee beans from selected estates throughout the world. 
 
Alakef Coffee Roasters supports fair trade and sustainable agriculture. Towards this philosophy, we source specialty grade coffees with Rainforest Alliance certification to ensure comprehensive sustainable farm management that protects the environment for future generations of coffee growers. By partnering with these producers, we are providing the highest quality coffees, while reinforcing our commitment to the farmers and the environment. 
 
In addition to carefully selecting the origin of our coffees, we roast our coffee to order and then package and ship the coffee the same day. Our goal is to ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, perfectly roasted, coffee possible.

City Girl Coffee Company was launched November of 2015 by Alakef Coffee Roasters. City Girl is a sustainable and responsible coffee company working to bring awareness and equality to the women of the coffee industry. We source our coffee from small, women owned or managed farms and co-operatives, and give a portion of every sale back to the organizations that support the success of women in their country of origin.
name: Alakef Coffee Roasters, Inc. |  City Girl Coffee Company
