We can supply following types of steel belts: MT1650/MT1500/MT1050 Martensitic Stainless Steel Belts, AT1200/AT1000 Austenitic Stainless Steel Belts, DT980 Super Corrosion Resistant Dual Phase Stainless Steel Belt, CT1300/CT1100 Carbon Steel Belts, DT1320 Dual Phase Carbon Steel Belt, etc.

Our steel belts are widely applied to various industries, and they are playing the role of core component in all industrial automation process systems. Like: Wood Based Panel Industry (continuous double belt press / Mende press / single opening press), Chemical Industry (cooling flaking / pastillating machines), Rubber Industry (rubber rotary curing vulcanizer - Rotocure / plate vulcanizing machinery), Food Industry (tunnel bakery oven / drier for fruit and vegetables / IQF machine / meat conveyor / chocolate production lines / coffee cooling line...), Film Casting Industry (super-mirror-polished-steel-belt), Conveyor & Sorter Systems, Ceramic Industry (ceramic press), Steel Belt Sintering Oven, Scattering, Lamination (textured structure steel belt), Automotive Industry (tile testing), Papermaking Industry (metal belt calender), Aviation Industry (tunnel wind experiment) and Artificial Marble Industry, etc.

We have professional belt after-sales service system, located in nearly ten countries and regions around the world.

Apart from steel belt, Mingke can also supply belt equipment, like: Isostatic Double Belt Press, Chemical flaking/pastill

description:
ELATEC brings together industry-leading RFID technology with unbeatable software and service. Our universal RFID readers enable user identification and secure access for all kinds of applications, including physical access control, secure printing, single sign-on, fleet management, bike and car sharing, gaming, vending and ticketing, and more. Our solutions leverage RFID and smartphone-based technologies (BLE and NFC) to connect people with places, goods, services and systems. We work with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and end-users to design flexible, future-proof authentication solutions that will meet your needs for today and tomorrow. 

Service: Our team is with you all the way with expert advice and hands-on help, from needs analysis and product selection to implementation and post-sale support. With ELATEC, you will always have access to the experts you need to ensure the smooth implementation and long-term success of your RFID project. 

Products: We’ll help you find the optimal product for every project. We offer single- and multi-frequency readers/writers in many configurations—including the powerful TWN4 MultiTech family of readers, capable of reading 60+ global RFID technologies as well as BLE and NFC. We can also customize solutions for your application. No other reader on the market offers more options or can be customized as quickly! 

Software: Our software solutions help you get the most out of your RFID reader/writer. Our Software Development Kit is the most powerful and configurable RFID software package on the market, so you can configure your reader for your precise security standards, communication protocols and IT infrastructure. Remote configuration tools make it easy to upgrade and maintain installed readers, wherever they are.
name: ELATEC GmbH

description:
Over 125 years of innovation have made Mankiewicz one of the world's leading manufacturers of high-quality coating solutions for industrial series production. From small manufacturers to large global corporations, Mankiewicz is at ease in the Automotive, Aviation, Railway, Machinery, Yacht, and Wind Power industries. Countless projects and challenges have shaped the company and its product portfolio into what it is today. Mankiewicz's paint flew to the moon on a camera lens in 1969. A Hollywood mission brought Mankiewicz to the big screen in the 1990s. In "Golden Eye," the interior of James Bond's BMW Z3 was painted with Mankiewicz paint - not shaken, but well stirred by the Mankiewicz experts. Their innovative technologies give final products a unique design, and by improving the durability of assets, Mankiewicz supports extended product lifecycles, circularity, and reuse while preserving both renewable and non-renewable sources.

Mankiewicz sees the company's responsibilities beyond business performance and drives the continued focus on sustainability from an ecological, economic, and social perspective. The company believes integrating sustainability parameters and collaboration along the entire value chain and the community can profoundly impact the industry, people, and the environment. As a privately held company in the 4th generation of ownership, Mankiewicz ensures their efforts are sustainable for future generations.
name: Mankiewicz Coatings LLC

description:
PILATUS is a 3-year project aiming to demonstrate 3 digitalised pilot lines for the production in Europe of silicon wafers, solar cells, and modules by 2025. PILATUS will leverage on the patented and already proven back-contacted
silicon heterojunction “tunnel-IBC” technology to ensure achieving its ambitious targets. PILATUS will prove a production capacity of 15 MW for M10 silicon wafers in Norway using polysilicon from Europe and demonstrate the feasibility of an expansion to 5 GW wafer production capacity.PILATUS’PV module pilot line will reach a minimum of 170 MW of annual production capacity, accompanied with 190 MW cell capacity that by itself adds 30% to the current
total capacity for PV cell production in Europe. Combining inline metrology and outdoor monitoring with the support of Industry 4.0 concepts all along the production chain, the cells and modules fabricated on PILATUS’ pilot lines will be analysed and feedback provided to the manufacturing process to ensure reaching ≥ 90 % yield at the end of the project. With the goal to establish PV modules with high durability, PILATUS targets to demonstrate the way towards > 40 years product lifetime by gaining fundamental insights into the degradation mechanisms and providing mitigation solutions thanks to the inline and outdoor metrology units that will be developed in the scope of the project. Further, PILATUS will prove a reduced environmental footprint compared to current technologies by demonstrating modules fully made from recycled materials, eco-design practices to facilitate the dismantling of PV panels, and manufacturing plants compliant with environmental standards. In short, PILATUS will contribute to re-building a “made in Europe”, leading-edge, competitive PV industry with the entire value chain been retained in Europe, compliant to the latest environmental
standards, hence fostering the affordability, the security of supply, and the sustainability of the future EU low-carbon
energy system
name: PILATUS

description:
BBG has solved many environmental and energy consumption problems associated with traditional breweries and carbonated beverage manufacturers. Using a combination of advanced technologies, BBG can build beverage manufacturing facilities that are CO2 neutral, energy self-sufficient, and capable of high-volume production at a much lower cost than traditional manufacturers. 

BBG is able to achieve CO2 neutrality by using advanced CO2 recovery techniques. When producing beer, breweries conduct a process of malting, milling, mashing, and fermenting grain. During this process, a significant amount of CO2 is created and released. BBG recovers the CO2 that would otherwise be lost and stores it for its own use and for resale.

BBG is not just energy self-sufficient, it can generate enough energy to sell surplus electricity back to the power grid. During the brewing process, residual materials such as spent grains and yeast can be fermented to form biogas. In BBG’s facilities, biogas is converted into thermal and electrical energy in a combined heat and power unit (CHP). 

In addition, after being used to produce biogas, the remnants of the brewing process can be recycled to sell as protein supplements and fertilizer.

BBG uses much less water than traditional beverage manufacturers. In a typical brewery or beverage plant, anywhere from one to three gallons of water is used for every gallon of beer or beverage produced. The water reclamation and purification system we use reduces water use by 80%. Further purification and treatment of water can be used to help replicate the flavor profile of almost any beer. This allows BBG to formulate and supply beer to other brands.
name: Bavarian Beer Group

The store was known for their fresh, delicious donuts and the staff never refused a special request.

Based on the donut shop’s phenomenal success and widespread reputation, Ray LaMar and his wife Shannon, made the decision in 1990 to franchise LaMar’s Donuts. Today, we have 25 locations in five states: Arizona, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, and Nebraska. LaMar’s Donuts have been recommended by Zagat’s Survey, The New Yorker and Gourmet Magazine, and was chosen in the summer of 2008 as one of America’s five best donuts by AOL Cityguide.

Ray was a guest on Good Morning America, The Today Show and The Tonight Show with Jay Leno. Hallmark Cards designed a greeting card in his honor and the Kansas Trivial Pursuit game has a question that reads: “Where do you stand in line for donuts in Kansas City?” Answer: LaMar’s Donuts.

Featuring an innovative menu, Einstein Bros. Bagels serves freshly-baked bagels, made-to-order hot sandwiches, signature shmears, specialty coffees and teas, baked sweets and more. Bakers rise with the roosters and bake all day long to deliver guests the Einstein Bros. Bagels experience based on the principle of spreading joy, happiness and laughter to start the day.
 
The brand began franchising in 1995 and opened its first non-traditional location in 1997. Since then, it has become a leading brand in the breakfast segment, with a total of 700 locations across 40 states.
 
Einstein Bros. Bagels is part of Bagel Brands, a subsidiary of Panera Brands, which includes Bruegger’s Bagels, Manhattan Bagel, and Noah’s NY Bagels. Across all Bagel Brands there are just under 1,000 locations.
 
For more information about Einstein Bros. Bagels, visit https://www.einsteinbros.com/.

description:
At Coffee & Bagel Brands we believe in the power of &. We love our coffee and we love our bagels. And we know our guests do too! Imagine the power of the greatest bagelries setting up shop with the most beloved coffeehouse – and that’s exactly what we did.

We are a collection of the best of breakfast, with each brand bringing their own unique history and heart:

In 1987, Manhattan Bagel Co. was founded in New Jersey with the intent of introducing bagels beyond the New York area and quickly expanded to fill a burgeoning demand.

In 1995, a new company was formed in Denver, Colorado called Einstein Bros. Bagels. This company was the culmination of bagel chains from across the United States and the company benefited from the group’s industry experience, passion and creativity. This company soon evolved to include Noah’s New York Bagels and Manhattan Bagel to later become the Einstein Noah Restaurant Group.

In 2014, Caribou Coffee and Einstein Noah Restaurant Group came together to bring our Guests the best breakfast this side of anywhere. Guests will find Caribou Coffee locations with Einstein’s bagels and Einstein Bros. Bagels locations with Caribou Coffee! In 2017 we grew again with the addition of Bruegger’s Bagels, which brought 35 years of history and tradition to the family. We call ourselves Coffee & Bagel Brands.

Our purpose at Coffee & Bagel Brands is to create Bright Spots for our guests and for each other. This is all about making someone’s day. When we can do that consistently, it has the potential to ripple out to the wider world making better days and even a better world.

Bright Spot. Better Day. Better World.
name: Manhattan Bagel

Au Bon Pain offers consumers a wide array of delicious, nutritional foods that include low-sodium, low-fat, gluten-free, vegan and vegetarian options. Calorie counts are clearly posted on menus and full nutritional information is provided in each café which has helped the brand earn Health magazine’s designation as one of America’s Top 5 Healthiest Restaurant Chains over the past three years and one of America’s Healthiest Restaurant Chains by Grellin.

Au Bon Pain operates in six key trade channels including urban office buildings, hospitals, universities, transportation centers, malls and museums. Au Bon Pain currently operates in more than 300 locations in the U.S. and internationally. Additional information about Au Bon Pain, which is headquartered in Boston, may be found at aubonpain.com. description:
From local baker to international family business

People have been enjoying our pastry since 1904. Hermanus Daelmans started his local bakery in Vlijmen (near Den Bosch). The sole trader grew over the years to become a modern, international and independent family business. But these products are still as tasteful as they were then. This is why we are proud to say that more than a billion of our products are enjoyed each year!

Cakes and pastries for private labels

We produce absolutely delicious cakes and pastries for tens of national and international private labels at three locations. We work intensively closely with pretty much all major retailers and “out-of-home” organizations from our head office in Nieuwkuijk and our offices in the UK and the USA. Our products are available in pretty much all supermarkets in the Netherlands and are exported to at least thirty countries.

Market leader

We are the national market leader in coconut pastry  and speculaas biscuits and worldwide market leader in caramel waffles (syrup waffles). We invest in growth as expansion enables us to make the best pastries, which retail chains can confidently entrust to their private labels. Would you like to know what we stand for? Then read our vision and mission and take a look at our values.

Would you as a retailer like to know how together, we can help you increase sales of your cakes and pastries? The read more on partnering or contact us directly.
name: Daelmans Group

SIMBA Chain’s platform allows for secure, reliable and verifiable data interactions across any system. Our comprehensive solution suite marries the power of decentralized identifiers (DIDs) and verifiable credentials (VCs) with the security assurance of blockchain transactions - delivering low-cost data exchange that is secure, portable and third party verified.

SIMBA allows for secure mission critical data exchange - across any systems, at any time. Connect your data with vendors, suppliers, resellers and internal teams with ease - and trust.

description:
A minority, woman-owned business, Chai Diaries is one of the leading providers of black, green and herbal teas along with instant chai premixes in the private label and specialty food service & retail tea market in the USA.

Chai Diaries signature Little Black Tins & Instant chai latte premix pouches are available nationally, including retail chains like
WholeFoods NE Region
H-E-B, Texas
Safeway Colorado
Amazon.com
Walmart.com
Kroger.com

Chai Diaries has a strong foundation in tea growing and manufacturing. 
With over 150 years of family tea history, Chai Diaries is inspired by the beauty and simplicity of life on a tea estate.

Our mission is to provide a moment of mindfulness through your daily cup of tea.

Our story begins with Ami trying to find an oasis of calm within the very busy streets of NYC. Far, far away from her home in the beautiful tea estates in India, a moment of mindfulness seemed elusive in the “city that never sleeps”. She dreamed of introducing America to the simplicity of slowing down and creating space to pause, only to be recharged with purpose, through a moment of mindfulness- found quite simply through a sip of Chai Diaries tea.
Expertly blended with key ingredients aiming to engage the mind, body and soul in a restorative ritual, Chai Diaries was born out of this nostalgia.
Manufacturing and blending teas for all times of the day-from breakfast to nighttime chill and all personalities – the caffeine-addict to the mom trying to catch a break – Chai Diaries teas are made in India and enjoyed  worldwide.

description:
thyssenkrupp is an international industrial and technology company employing around 100,000 people. Across 48 countries it generated sales of €38 billion in fiscal 2022/2023. Since October 1, 2023, the business activities have been bundled into five segments: Automotive Technology, Decarbon Technologies, Materials Services, Steel Europe and Marine Systems. Backed by extensive technological know-how, the businesses develop cost-effective and resource-friendly solutions to the challenges of the future. Around 4,000 employees work in research and development at 75 locations all over the world, mainly in the fields of climate protection, the energy transition, digital transformation in the industry and mobility of the future. thyssenkrupp currently has a portfolio of approximately 14,630 patents and utility models. Under the thyssenkrupp umbrella brand the company creates long-term value with innovative products, technologies and services and contributes to a better life for future generations. To this end, the company pursues ambitious climate protection targets and optimizes its own energy and climate efficiency. At the same time, it uses its diverse abilities along the relevant value chains to play a significant role in driving forward its customers’ green transformation. thyssenkrupp is listed in the MDAX index. thyssenkrupp shares are traded on Frankfurt Stock Exchange (symbol: TKA) and as American depositary receipts (symbol: TKAMY) in the USA.

If you have any HR related questions, please send us an e-mail to career@thyssenkrupp.com or visit our global career site: https://karriere.thyssenkrupp.com/en

description:
Are you looking for a unique and vibrant place to start a business, work, or live? Discover the Village of Riverside, one of the first planned communities in the United States. Riverside is a close suburb of Chicago with lots to offer besides proximity to the City.

Business owners will find an upper-middle-class customer base with one of the highest per capita incomes in the area, an ideal market for restaurant and catering businesses, stylish boutiques, upscale chains, and existing service and retail chains looking for a second location.

Job seekers, keep an eye on our job listings. Our collaborative environment values teamwork and new ideas. 

Anyone looking to escape City life without moving too far out, look no further than the Village of Riverside. Frederick Law Olmsted, the Father of Landscape Architecture, was the creative mind behind the unique design of the Village, complementing the community's historical value. Over the past 130 years, Riverside has matured into a beautiful, vibrant "Village in the Forest." Many of the original elements of Olmsted's plan, including expansive green parkways, gas-lit street lanterns, and curvilinear streets, are still intact. As a result, the Village has enjoyed a National Historic Landmark designation since 1970.
name: Village of Riverside

description:
Gala Capital Partners (GCP) is a private investment firm based in Southern California with deep roots in the restaurant industry. We seek to invest in or acquire distressed or growth-oriented multiunit businesses, as well as SaaS software companies that support multiunit businesses, whom have sound performance results and a capable management team. We will also selectively invest in strategic and value-add real estate opportunities.

We are patient, long-term investors that build trusting partnerships with management teams. We aim to add value by leveraging our multi-concept platform and applying our deep experience as both a franchisee and a franchisor in the industry to help build and grow profitable companies and sharing that growth and success with the teams that help us. Although we prefer a control position, we can work with different flexible investment structure that include management buyouts, convertible notes, or subordinated debt.

To date our portfolio consists of several franchisors including MOOYAH, Dunn Brothers Coffee, Dillas Primo Quesadillas and Rusty Taco as well as several others. In addition, we invested in a number of exciting SaaS software companies such as Ecotrak, Targetable, Stream and Lunchbox that enable restaurant operators to run their business more effectively.
name: Gala Capital Partners

description:
Lever Foundation is a 501(c)3 tax-exempt public charity headquartered in the United States, with a diverse team based primarily in Asia with additional staff in Europe and the Americas. Lever creates a more humane and sustainable protein supply chain in Asia by upgrading animal protein to reduce animal suffering and advancing alternative protein to ease agriculture's impact on the environment by removing the most intensive factory farming practices.

About Lever's Program Work:
Lever works with talented entrepreneurs across mainland China and Southeast Asia to create new alternative protein companies and offer critical early support to promising existing startups to develop a more sustainable, scalable food supply. Lever is also active with food companies and media outlets to increase interest and activity in the sector and educate consumers.

Lever works with food companies and producers to help remove the worst factory farming cruelties from their supply chains. This work includes comprehensive animal welfare policies impacting egg-laying hens, broiler chickens, pigs, cows, and fish. Lever has engaged with over 4,000 companies, including; Restaurant Brands International, METRO Group, JDE Peets, Hilton, Marriott, and many others.
name: Lever Foundation

Arcturus focuses on its customers and their needs, creating unique concepts for the table, kitchen and interior. With more than 1.300 employees, the Group is globally active and has offices in Italy, Germany, France, USA and China.

description:
With a new 80,000 sq. ft. facility, in American Fork, Utah, ThermoWorks is a high-growth technology company dedicated to superior temperature instrumentation and sensors for the food service industry as well as food processing, pharmaceuticals, transportation, manufacturing, and other markets in science and industry. In addition to being the top choice for demanding commercial users, ThermoWorks professional temperature tools are rated number one for discriminating home chefs and BBQ experts alike. 

The new Utah headquarters is the home of our in-house customer care and tech support teams, as well as our commercial sales, quality assurance, product development, marketing, and fulfillment teams. It also houses a demo kitchen, a training facility, warehouse, and an advanced A2LA-accredited temperature standards lab. 

ThermoWorks products are found in virtually every industry. You can find us in home kitchens where our Thermapen® ONE has improved the cooking and dining experience of hundreds of thousands of food lovers. You can find us in commercial kitchens—from small independents to large national chains—across America. Hundreds of food processing plants and farming operations use our products, from dairy, to produce, to meat, seafood, and poultry. Cold-chain managers, including those for grocery stores and convenience markets, employ our loggers and thermometers to make sure food travels and arrives safely and in top quality. We also work with pharmaceutical makers that depend on temperature control for both processes and storage. 

You'll also find ThermoWorks tools in road construction and repair, heavy industry, manufacturing, utilities, heating and air conditioning, plastics and rubber, research and science, as well as dozens of hobby applications. Anywhere temperature is critical, ThermoWorks products are hard at work.
name: ThermoWorks, Inc.

description:
Minit Mart offers customers everything they need in one convenient stop. From filling up with branded gas to grabbing a refreshing fountain beverage or cup of coffee to satisfying a hearty appetite with delicious food, made fast and fresh, Minit Mart has it all. 

And Minit Mart goes beyond convenience shopping. Customers will find a variety of retailer gift cards, electronics, clothing, and other unique items. All within a sparkling clean and friendly environment.

In 1967, a father and son named Ralph and Fred Higgins founded the first Minit Mart store in Lexington, Kentucky. Minit Mart became one of the first convenience stores to add gas pumps in the 1970s, which became a large innovation among convenience stores across the United States. The convenience store chain expanded into Tennessee in the 1980s, and then later into 7 other states.
Since then, Minit Mart has grown to 225 stores. Many locations offer Godfather’s Pizza, O’Deli’s, and many other branded fast food chains. In 2015, Travel Centers of America purchased all Minit Mart locations. In late 2018, Travel Centers of America sold all Minit Mart locations to EG Group.

Minit Mart and EG America also operates several other U.S. based sister-companies, including Cumberland Farms, Certified Oil, Fastrac, Kwik Shop, Loaf N Jug, Quik Stop, Tom Thumb, Turkey Hill, and Minit Mart.

EG America’s parent company is EG Group, located in Blackburn, England. EG Group is the world’s leading independent fuel station and convenience retailer, with a diversified portfolio of sites across eight countries in Europe and North America. The business receives regular recognition for innovation and investment; Zuber Issa and Mohsin Issa, Founders and co-CEOs of EG Group, were jointly named the 2016 NACS Insight European Convenience Industry Leader of the Year.
Further information is available at www.eurogarages.com.
name: Minit Mart

We have represented partners and shareholders in corporate disputes over corporate assets, including disputes over real estate, and aggressively work to obtain a satisfactory resolution of complicated commercial disputes for our clients.

We strive to be known in the community as experienced attorneys who provide quality legal services for individual and commercial clients in a consistently ethical, responsible, timely and cost-effective manner. We believe in an environment that shows respect and professionalism not only to our clients but also to our adversaries and their counsel. By doing so we establish goodwill that ultimately benefits you.

We represent clients from Duval to Dade counties; however, we primarily represent clients in Hillsborough, Hernando, Manatee, Pasco, and Pinellas counties.

description:
Pura Vida Café: the organic coffee roaster company 
 
Pura Vida Café is an organic coffee roaster based in Northern Italy. Since its founding in 2003, it has specialized in roasting high quality beans to offer a more refined blend of coffee to enthusiasts throughout the Italian peninsula. In 2010 we obtained organic certification. 
Our pursuit of quality is achieved through the careful selection of beans and a rigorous roasting quality control. We take pride in knowing that Pura Vida Café has helped numerous Italian outlets raise the taste profile of the coffee they serve. Our clients have gone on to win awards such as the prestigious “three coffee beans"​ by Gambero Rosso, perhaps the most important Italian culinary guide for restaurants, bars and coffee houses. In recent years, Pura Vida Café has secured arrangements directly with local organic coffee producers, encouraging the pursuit of high standards and eco-friendly production and growing processes. 
Our most important agreement to date is the Orang Utan coffee project in Sumatra. We are also working to reintroduce coffee from Haiti into Europe, which has become increasingly hard to find given the difficult situation in that country.
name: Pura Vida Café

description:
College friends, Sinclair and Julian, opened the first Pret A Manger in London in 1986. It was a shop with a mission to create handmade food, freshly prepared each day. The two of them had woefully little experience in the world of business. They created the sort of food they craved but couldn't find anywhere else.

30 years on, the mission remains unchanged. Pret operates a bit like a restaurant. We build kitchens in (or very near) every shop. You won’t find ‘sell-by’ dates on our fresh sandwiches and salads. Our milk and coffee is organic. We offer our unsold food to charity at the end of each day rather than keeping it to sell the next day.

We believe in good jobs for good people and we're looking for more to join our team. Our wonderful hardworking people make all the difference. They are the heart and soul of our business.
name: Pret A Manger

We are based in London, UK & San Francisco, California. We also have international presence in Italy, France, Spain and Canada. 

Mexico Real Cafe is specialized in the finest Mexican Coffee from Single Origins in Mexico. We focus on sustainability & environmentally friendly farming practices. Our organic certified coffee is Arabica Altura 100%. Our coffee grows in fincas at high altitude at the core of the biosphere reserve on the highlands of the Maya tropical rainforest on the border between Mexico and Guatemala. 

Only the berries that are at the peak of ripeness are picked individually by hand, and our Mexican artisan coffee combines the benefits of a humid and dry artisanal process. 

Mexico Real Coffee has a fruity and nutty flavour and its aroma is delicate and fresh. We supply to UK and worldwide, our Award Winning Specialty Coffee and Gourmet Arabica Coffees include Mexican Artisan Espresso Coffee and Arabica Whole Beans(High Altitude) for home roasting and weight loss. 

When buying Mexico Real Cafe you support shade-grown coffee producers to preserve the traditional method of coffee farming in the Mexican tropical rainforest. 

This Mexican evergreen rainforests are home of wild animals in danger of extinction such as the Jaguar, tapir, Quetzal and exotic plants that are indigenous to this Maya biosphere reserve. Search by mexico real cafe on Amazon Europe & USA, Ebay Europe.

This megadiverse small country in South America has some of the best varieties of cacao in the world, such as the country’s national “Arriba” or “Fine Aroma Cacao”, which has been used for many years for the best gourmet chocolate companies of the world. The flora and exotic fruits that grow in its surroundings influence the cacao to have a unique flavor and aroma. We are able to choose the best cacao for each application. description:
The Organic Trade Association (OTA) is the membership-based business association for the organic industry in North America. 

Focusing exclusively on organic agriculture and products, OTA stays on top of the issues that affect organic trade and takes action as necessary on behalf of its members, connecting them to market trends and industry news, regulatory and legislative advocacy, and consumer education, marketing and public relations resources. 

OTA's mission is to promote and protect ORGANIC with a unifying voice that serves and engages its diverse members from farm to marketplace. Our mission sets the stage for work on behalf of the diverse organic business community we serve. OTA represents businesses across the organic supply chain and addresses all things organic: food, fiber and textiles, personal care and pet products, and new sectors as they develop. 

Since its inception in 1985, OTA has been a key player in shaping both the regulatory and market environment for organic products. OTA works to develop markets for organic products, protect the integrity of organic standards, and foster consumer confidence in the organic label. 

Organic Trade Association: OTA.com
Organic business directory: TheOrganicPages.com
Directory of U.S. organic exporters: USOrganicProducts.com
Global Organic Trade Resource Guide: GlobalOrganicTrade.com
U.S. consumer education: OrganicItsWorthIt.org

name: Organic Trade Association

description:
Family owned and operated since 1888, Aiya is the world’s leading Japanese Matcha green tea producer, supplier, and innovator. Based in Nishio, Japan, Aiya oversees all phases of the Matcha production process from seed to bowl. With exceptional attention to detail and adherence to the highest global industry standards, Aiya is committed to providing high-quality organic and conventional Matcha ingredient grades for the food, beverage, and nutraceutical industries.

As the largest manufacturer of Matcha in the world, Aiya oversees all phases of the production process and has not had a product recall in its history of over 130 years. Vertically integrated with a network of over 200 family farmers, Aiya takes great pride in its longstanding generational relationships. With over 1,300 granite grinding mills operating 24 hours a day year-round, Aiya has the capability to procure and produce enough Matcha to supply the North American, European, and Japanese markets combined. Although our Matcha is grown and manufactured in Japan, sales and fulfillment are handled domestically, resulting in shorter lead times and lower minimums.

Aiya is the only Matcha tea company offering in-depth global resource and sales offices to support our international clientele. Contact one of our local representatives for questions.

For more information, visit www.aiya-america.com.
name: Aiya America, Inc. (Aiya Matcha)

description:
MAARA, founded by Dace and Robert in 2020, is an initiative dedicated to reshaping lifestyles and cultivating sustainability. Leaving the city life behind, we jumped into this adventure by buying 30 hectares of land with forests, waterfalls and grazelands, surrounded by the mountain stretches of the National Park of Três Picos, close to Nova Friburgo in Rio de Janeiro state. 

Our project has converted a conventional farm in a sustainable permaculture haven. Projects implemented include setting up all soft and hard infrastructure, building of an ecological sewage system, establishing an agroforest with focus on coffee, fruit, wood and nut production, partly with CO2 compensation. Additionally, we've undertaken bio-construction, created a natural pool, manage a volunteer community, and initiated an eco-pedagogic project with local schools to raise awareness about sustainable practices.

MAARA is more than a cultivation initiative; it aspires to be a reference and permaculture playground for like-minded individuals. The goal is to foster collaborative learning, share experiences, produce sustainable food, and enhance land fertility, productivity, and biodiversity. Rooted in principles of harmony and respect for nature and the local community, MAARA seeks to catalyse positive change, aspiring to be a beacon of inspiration for those passionate about creating a sustainable future.

We welcome volunteers from around the world, providing an opportunity to learn about permaculture, agroforest management, organic gardening, soil regeneration, composting, the importance of bees and other insects, as well as enjoying nutritious vegetarian meals and community living. Nestled in a comfortable farmhouse amid breath-taking mountainous scenery near Rio de Janeiro, it's the perfect setting to embark on a journey of discovery. Explore our website for the various possibilities.
name: Project MAARA

description:
Shared Interest Foundation (SIF) is a registered charity (1102375) founded in 2004 with head office in Newcastle upon Tyne. 

SIF aims to improve livelihoods through the development of sustainable businesses and income generation initiatives across Africa and Latin America. 

We work with local partners to implement projects that aim to:

1.	Support the development of sustainable income generating enterprises to improve livelihoods and contribute towards a reduction in poverty

2.	Economically empower women and youth 

3.	Support farmers to implement climate adaption agriculture techniques to build their climate resilience and increase environmental protection

4.	Strengthen the resilience and sustainability of co-operatives which support thousands of farmers and artisans

Over the past year, we delivered 14 projects, which supported the development of innovative initiatives to strengthen the climate resilience of producers, created income generating opportunities for women and young people, and established enterprises which generate vital income for rural communities. 

Whilst we support all SDGs, we feel our projects align closest with No Poverty (1), Gender Equality (5), Decent Work and Economic Growth (8), Climate Action (13) and Partnerships for the Goals (17), along with an additional theme of ‘Youth Engagement’.
name: Shared Interest Foundation

description:
We protect wildlife in wild places and on working lands by certifying enterprises that assure people and nature coexist and thrive. Certification of businesses and the use of scientifically sound standards ensure transparency and integrity of our activities.

We harness the power of enterprise to provide incentives for biodiversity protection around the world, and offer economic opportunity to people whose basic needs have put them in conflict with wildlife. 

We link Wildlife Friendly® products and services to consumers, enabling powerful brands to differentiate themselves in a crowded and increasingly values-driven marketplace.

Our Certified Wildlife Friendly™ Enterprises conserve over twelve million hectares of diverse wetlands, forests, and grasslands; protect keystone endangered species in Asia, Africa, and Latin and North America, and Europe, including the Snow Leopard, Red Panda, Elephant, Jaguar and Wolf; and benefit over 200,000 people through increased food security, income and employment. Our Certified Enterprises include Tour Operators, Lodges, Foods, Textiles, Spices, Ornaments, Paper Goods, and more.
name: Wildlife Friendly Enterprise Network

description:
We dream of a world with fewer but better products, favouring staying power over fading trends. Whether it is developing a bin, rethinking the modular kitchen, creating a furniture line or hosting the Vipp Hotel, we measure the quality of products and concepts on their long-term ability to provide an experience out of the ordinary.

It began as a love story.

Sometimes winning the lottery leads to more than just temporary excitement. When Vipp founder Holger Nielsen won a car on his ticket to the local soccer stadium in 1932 it was the beginning of Vipp. He just did not know it. He sold the car, bought a metal press and few years later, when his wife Marie needed a bin for her hairdressing salon, he went to his one-man workshop and crafted what today is known as the Vipp pedal bin. 

Holger could not have imagined that the pedal-controlled bin he designed in 1939 would eventually sow the seed for a full-blown design universe of accessories, furniture and kitchens. Nor that his bin would be a catalyst for a design hotel concept.

Vipp is still a family-owned, independent, Danish design company run by Holger’s daughter, Jette Egelund, her two children Kasper and Sofie together with 45 employees in Copenhagen, Denmark.
name: Vipp

description:
The world of Eichholtz was shaped three decades ago by an inventive dutchman: a pioneering creative genius with an eagle eye for art and design, and a visionary collector. Building a premium lifestyle brand from his impeccable intuition, he made his mark on today’s interior design business.

Now coveted and copied in all corners of the earth, our ever-surprising collections include on-trend yet timeless furniture, lighting and accessories – cutout for decorating the luxury homes of successful personalities around the globe.

Our collections are first and foremost created and curated for those to whom a life of luxury is a given. A wide product range in a host of different styles allows us to cater to the personal taste of each individual customer. We cater to a large and incredibly diverse international clientele: from interior designers and stylists to high-end furniture and department stores; from chic hotels and upscale restaurants to trendy beach clubs and exclusive ski resorts. 

Embracing innovation by nature, we are always on top of trends in art and design. Rooted in Europe, we are flourishing globally. Riding the infinite waves of seasonality, trusting our brand identity as a steadfast beacon.

Interested in becoming a Business Partner?
Our ambition is to become the best and most inspiring atmosphere maker in the world. To expand our business globally, we are always looking for upmarket business partners. If you are interested in becoming a partner, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@eichholtz.com.

name: World of Eichholtz

description:
Al-Telal Company for Food Industries was established in 2012 as a leading Egyptian company in the cultivation and production of table olives and olive oil.
The company was named after the hills in relation to the historical Sinai hills in the North Sinai desert (6000 BC), which were known for cultivating and squeezing olives.
- The company produces table olives of all kinds ). Telal's table olives are among the most demanded products for export to international markets. (The olive tree has existed in the Mediterranean basin for about 8,000 years, and Egypt was famous for its cultivation in the Sinai desert more than 6,000 years ago).
- The company works to extract pure virgin olive oil / extra virgin olive oil harvested from our farms in Arish, Sinai, filtered and packed inside our factories. Therefore, Al-Telal oils are characterized by the best quality because we have all stages of production from the fruit to the packed bottle, which makes us have supervision over the quality of the product at all stages to produce The finest types of olive oil.
In pickles, we produce "Mexican peppers, jalapenos, Tantawi, onions, lemons, peppers,  cucumbers and grape leaves" because we are interested in producing a wide range of different products that suit the tastes of the Egyptian and international markets.
- Natural bee honey (clover honey, citrus, , mountain sidr) with a saccharose ratio not exceeding 5% and a quality that all our customers testify to.
Telal owns different local sales channels: hotels, restaurants, supermarkets, distributors, pharmaceutical and cosmetic companies, in addition to making private labels for any food company, due to the quality of our products and the variety of packaging options.
Regarding the company's export: the main markets are the United States of America, Europe, Asia and some countries of the Middle East.
We are certified
/HALAL/ ISO 22000 / ISO 9001 /NFSA/ FDA certificate
name: Telal

description:
From the beginning of our company Agri-Business (Agriculture Business) both young entrepreneurs and employees have shown their interest in cooperation. The company is staffed by: i.) MSc. Konstantinos Papachristos - Agronomist, ii). MSc. George Katsikavelis - Agronomist,
Today our company has to its clientele, a variety of Agricultural Enterprises, with a large arable land. The company's strategy is to directly help agricultural entrepreneurs in order to produce products that with their brand and proven quality will conquer markets both at home and abroad. To achieve this goal, the company is committed to providing support services to producers, such as:
1. To analyze and manage with modern methods depending on the characteristics of the area (climatic conditions, soil, water resources), the type of crop and the profile of the producer, in order to achieve the maximum possible production efficiency, while reducing inputs.
2. To look for investment opportunities for the purchase of cultivated land and equipment for the further development of agricultural enterprises.
3. To analyze the suppliers and the purchased products (fertilizers, plant protection products) that the agricultural enterprise really needs, according to analyzes that will be carried out in certified laboratories.
4. To carry out financial and technical studies and to exploit investment programs for the better financing of the company with funds that will come from the fund of the European Union.
5. To contribute to the vertical production and the better management of the agricultural enterprise, with the purchase of equipment that will standardize, maintain and store the produced products.
6. To provide agricultural services, as farmers will now need specialized information and daily information on the selling price of agricultural products, as the price of many of them now has a market value.
In short, the ultimate goal of the company is to assist in all processes concerning agricultural enterprises
name: Agri-Business21

description:
REPIC (Renewable Energy and Resource Efficiency Promotion in International Cooperation) is a interdepartmental platform dedicated to promoting renewable energy, energy efficiency, and resource efficiency in developing and transition countries. Our mission is to facilitate the transfer of knowledge and technology, fostering sustainable development worldwide.
At REPIC, we are committed to supporting innovative projects driven by Swiss institutions that focus on practical solutions and market-oriented approaches. By leveraging our extensive network and expertise, we aim to catalyze positive change and drive sustainable development in the global energy sector.

Project Promotion and Realization:
We actively promote and support projects that emphasize renewable energy, energy efficiency, and resource efficiency in developing and transition countries. We facilitate the implementation of impactful projects that make a tangible difference in local communities.

Network, Information, and Communication:
We foster a network of stakeholders, including experts and organizations to facilitate the exchange of knowledge and best practices. Our platform serves as a hub for sharing valuable insights and success stories.

Join us in our mission to create a more sustainable and equitable world. Together, we can accelerate the transition towards renewable energy, enhance energy efficiency, and promote responsible resource management in international cooperation.

An interdepartmental platform of the Swiss Federal Offices SECO, SFOE, FOEN and SDC.
name: REPIC

The Beasley Group is a third-generation family business headquartered in Hazlehurst, Georgia. Since 1968, we’ve become a hardwood forest products industry leader. Core businesses include timberlands, procurement, logging, logistics, and mills with customers in the North America, Europe, and Asia. 

Vertically-integrated synergies have fueled our growth to become the largest hardwood sawmill in the United States and North America’s foremost producer of crane mats and timbers for the energy transmission, utility, and construction industries. In addition to mats, we offer crossties, grade lumber, industrial lumber, pallet lumber, renewable energy, and finished goods, such as flooring products.

Understanding customer-driven demand, the Beasley Group has developed multiple nationwide and international sales channels. Quality service, reliability, and attention to detail are our secret to building customer loyalty and satisfaction. We distribute Red Oak, White Oak, Ash, Poplar, Hickory, Tupelo, Cypress, Soft Maple, and Pine. Extensive market knowledge and product design experience enable us to offer both standardized and customized lumber, timbers, and wood flooring.

We have a recognized track record of business expansion through organic growth and strategic investments in related or sector-adjacent forest products industry leaders, known for their product quality and customer relationships. The Beasley Group invests in our people and our communities to build long-term sustainable businesses.

description:
Alpha Dominche is an American company based in Brooklyn, New York. We design and build advanced coffee and tea brewing equipment with equal emphasis on innovation and craftsmanship.

STEAMPUNK® offers a new path forward in the industry, bringing specialty coffee and tea to a larger community by transforming quality brewing into a streamlined and interactive process. Our consumer lineup, beginning with the FLASK™ Brewer, brings our innovative and aesthetically engineered products to home users around the world.
 
Our approach to designing brewing equipment is inspired by our name, which means "first of its kind."​ We created a brewing system that offers unprecedented extraction, temperature control and thermal stability. Our brew process allows baristas to serve coffee and tea with their own unique brew parameters and precise, balanced flavors that result in an extraordinary cup. Our products give cafes, restaurants, hotels, and even home users a unique brewing experience unlike any other in our industry.

In early 2017 we opened our retail showroom -  Extraction Lab -- in Brooklyn Industry City. The Extraction Lab is an innovative concept cafe that features the STEAMPUNK® brewer and serves as a space for guests to experience the world's best coffees and teas from more than 40 world-class producers.

description:
Bona Fide Brewing Company is all about nitro cold brew coffee and tea!


We have spent 5 years perfecting our proprietary “Craft Draft” process, which takes coffee and tea into the category of fine beer and wine. Craft Draft technology allows for the complete preparation of our coffee and tea in advance, imbeds flavor stability into our kegs and provides these valuable advantages:

1. Food safe, unparalleled, protection of each product’s unique and extraordinary flavor profile, conveniently packaged in sanitary Sanke kegs.

2. Guaranteed 90 day refrigerated and 30 day ambient, keg stability which practically eliminates product expiration issues (that is 3 times the life of our competitor’s cold brew kegs).

3. Efficient, proven dispensing system which eliminates preparation labor and costly mistakes at the serving point.

4. Our products are made with the best organic and natural ingredients available, pure water, organic coffee and pure nitrogen gas. No artificial preservatives or stabilizers are used in our process.

We have a Nitro Coffee and Tea Solution for the following:
• High Volume Food Service Establishments

• Airports & Other Transportation Facilities
• College & University Campuses

description:
Our original Main Street Café was founded in 1991, and began operations as a small deli in the old Capitol Theatre building on Main Street in Willimantic, CT. Occupying both the lobby and concession area of the theatre, seating was limited to 50 people. After 3 years we were bursting at the seams and made the move to 877 Main Street, another historic building. There we expanded to a full service restaurant and featured American craft-brewed beers and an extensive menu.

One more move was in the cards for us, and we made yet another trek down Main Street to our home in the current granite and limestone 1909 U.S. Post Office Building. Abandoned in 1967 by the Federal Government this building lay vacant for nearly 30 years. When used as a post office, our dining room was the post office work room, our pub was the customer lobby, and the private dining room was the Postmaster‘s office. Although extensive renovations have been made to the building, we wanted to retain the early 20th century architecture as well as create a pleasant atmosphere for dining. Remnants of post office memorabilia have been preserved to add to the flavor of the restaurant. Featured in our dining room is a 12‘ by 17‘ mural, created by Gordan MacDonald, depicting 1920‘s Main Street scene. A 60‘ mahogany bar, crafted by Peter Huckins is the centerpiece of the pub area. 

It is in this building that the Willimantic Brewing Company was born. Viewed from our Dining Room, our 7 barrel brewery produces our freshly made handcrafted beers. Please feel free to explore our main floor and discover all our hidden treasures. On behalf of our entire staff, we welcome you and hope you share in our excitement for our living landmark restaurant and pub brewery.
name: Willimantic Brewing Company/Main Street Cafe

description:
Founded in 2017, we grow, source and select coffees from Brazil and ship them across the globe to roasteries that understand that quality and ethics can exist hand in hand. We are proud to actively search for new ways to trade and grow coffee. Connecting farmers directly to roasters sets us apart from a dated system of large cooperatives and exporters in a Brazilian context. We take care of the complete supply-chain, door to door. 

Technology plays a central role in our day-to-day lives – and so should it when choosing our coffees. Currently developing a marketplace, we seek to reduce information asymmetries between growers and roasters, bringing them closer together. Growers need to understand the value of their product and be at liberty to directly market their beans to coffee lovers around the globe.

Our presence in Brazil, Europe and the US gives us the chance to connect the largest coffee origin to the largest coffee consumers. The concentration on solely Brazil as a source allows us to increase the efficiency of our value-chain from farm to cup. 

São Paulo | Berlin | New York

description:
What began in 1957 as a small artisanal roastery in Beirut, established by founding father Michel Najjar, has gone on to become a leading company with a majority share of the Lebanese coffee market and a thriving global export business to 48 countries worldwide. Today we produce from the largest coffee factory in Lebanon, equipped with the most highly advanced computerized coffee machinery in the Middle East and among the finest in the Mediterranean basin. 
 
From the first generation all the way down through to today’s third generation, the name Najjar continues to be synonymous with the freshest, best tasting coffee. Indeed, the company’s commitment to, and passion for, constant innovation and improvement, has made the Café Najjar brand a reference point in the region. 
 
This passion for innovation has also seen the company expand its portfolio to become a multi-brand success story, always backed by an unwavering emphasis on quality. In addition to its range of branded coffee, and coffee machines (Multirama, Caferama, Il Gustino and Gia), Café Najjar is the exclusive distributor of Turkish coffee machines to the vast majority ofmajor restaurants, universities, schools and offices in Lebanon. The company’s own hospitality franchise Café Najjar - La Maison du Café is present in 14 locations across the region, while more recently the launch of Théa Rituels de thés tea bar brought the finest quality tea experience to Lebanon.
name: Société Ets. Michel Najjar sal

description:
The truth is most coffee professionals found themselves in their career position by accident. Maybe they started working as a barista for a temporary job and then they fell in love with the innumerable ways to brew coffee. Then they start to learn about the multifaceted approach to roasting coffee and that leads into the discovery of how every coffee growing region employs different methods to produce this incredible crop. That's us, we are passionate, engaged, and always willing to learn!

We know how much work it takes for coffee to be grown in a responsible manner and while we wish we could take credit for how good our coffee is, it really comes down to our producers and their dedication to their craft. The best a coffee will ever be is while it is in our producers hands, we just try to ensure we roast and serve that coffee to its potential.

description:
Cangshan (pronounced Kang-Shan) is the name of a mountain located in southern China and is also the name of a small city where our company founder Henry Liu was born. Eventually, Henry started a kitchenware company and after 11 years it grew from 1 to over 800 people and from 5,000 sf2 to 78,000 sf2 as well as 3 manufacturing facilities. It was Henry’s vision and the pursuit of excellence without compromise that allowed this amount of growth in such a short time.

Henry decided he would leave the day to day operations in China and journey to the United States because he likes a challenge. He wanted to pursue the American Dream like all other American Dreamers from The Mayﬂower to this day. He located the elite material manufacturers from Germany, Sweden, Japan, and the USA, but could not ﬁnd the right one even after auditing 80+ knifemakers. It seemed all of them just wanted to handle basic knives like most of the popular brands, there seemed to be no passion to create something unique.

Yangjiang China, where cutlery has been a tradition for over 1500 years and is where Henry found a common connection of people who envisioned knives as a passion and made a long-term joint-venture partnership plan with the factory. This is how Cangshan Cutlery Company was born.

Cangshan is unique in offering both Western and Japanese style and performance of products to satisfy the most discriminating members of even the world’s top chefs while at the same time never sacriﬁcing design.

The world has already recognized the high standard of design and performance by awarding our knives with two Red Dot 2016 Design Awards,  four Red Dot 2017 Design Awards, three A’ 2017 Design Awards, two 2017 Housewares Design Finalist Awards, an IDEA 2017 Design Finalist Award, a Gourmet Gold Award, Gourmet Retailer Editors Choice and 4 German Design 2018 Awards . But the most important award is the reviews and feedback from our thousands of happy customers!
name: Cangshan Cutlery Company

description:
Since 1944, the TAMKO story has been one of innovation, quality and long-standing customer relationships. Though a lot has changed since we introduced our first shingle more than 75 years ago in Joplin, Missouri, one thing remains the same: our commitment to constantly moving the industry forward with a wide variety of building products.

Our more than seven decades of success is the direct result of teamwork, enduring relationships with customers, suppliers and employees, and our company-wide commitment to continuous improvement, including the Six Sigma program, a business strategy and management philosophy designed to improve our processes and products.

Vertical integration is also a key part of TAMKO’s success. We are a vertically integrated company, owning and operating several of our own raw materials plants. Maintaining greater control over the entire manufacturing process allows us to deliver consistent supply by reducing shortages and delivery times.

Today, TAMKO operates manufacturing and warehouse facilities across the country in order to serve its customers with roofing and building products.
name: TAMKO

Formed in May 2020 through the combination of the Demilec and Icynene-Lapolla SPF businesses, Huntsman Building Solutions, a business unit of Huntsman Corporation, has a combined heritage of more than 110 years insulating homes and buildings.
 
Through the ecothermal approach to product design, leveraging sustainable innovative technology, Huntsman Building Solutions focuses on meeting market demands for more energy-efficient building envelope serving a range of industries, including residential, commercial, industrial, institutional, and agricultural.
 
Huntsman Solutions Bâtiments (HSB) fabrique de la mousse de polyuréthane giclée, des enduits et des barrières thermiques pour les toits, les greniers et les murs. Créée en mai 2020 par l’intégration des activités de Demilec et d'Icynene-Lapolla, Huntsman Solutions Bâtiments, une division de Huntsman Corporation, possède une expérience combinée de plus de 110 ans dans l'isolation des maisons et des bâtiments.
 
Grâce à l'approche écothermique de la conception des produits, qui s'appuie sur une technologie innovante et durable, Huntsman Solutions Bâtiments s'efforce de répondre aux demandes du marché en matière d'enveloppe de bâtiment à haute efficacité énergétique, au service de plusieurs industries, notamment résidentielles, commerciales, industrielles, institutionnelles et agricoles.
name: Huntsman Building Solutions / Huntsman Solutions Bâtiments

description:

Salvex has designed an efficient and comprehensive asset recovery program for major corporations to manage the sale of all surplus and end-of-life assets. Our online tools and comprehensive global database has given asset managers, procurement departments and CFO’s the ability to maximize the recovery of un-needed assets. For the first time in history, bidders from around the world can all view and bid on an item in real time. The global reach we provide allows our company to direct equipment and commodities to places where they are needed the most. Salvex has commodity traders positioned around the world that will assist in the logistics and payment schedule to ensure that the cultural business gaps are bridged. This brings a higher level of success when commencing international trades.

Most products are commercial from all 16 major sectors of commerce. The retail products are usually large quantities that require special types of buyers. Salvex has found innovative ways to match buyers and sellers through sophisticated database categorization, which pairs the right products for sale with the best potential buyers. The suppliers enjoy quick and easy access to the global secondary markets by creating a legible, easy-to-read listing with accurate and comprehensive information, enabling the potential buyers to easily access global salvage opportunities and reintroduce these unfortunate products back into the world of commerce. This entire 'exercise'​ is recycling at its optimum level, reaching all corners of the world.

After handling over 20,000 salvage deals globally, Salvex has developed relationships with adjusters, inspectors and marine surveyors. Salvex has utilized these contacts and experts to offer back inspection work from our major clients. The experience with these individuals, backed by an enterprise claims software, allows Salvex to offer tools that give their clients a competitive advantage.

description:
In 1926, Carl Detering opened The Detering Company. He was joined shortly thereafter by his brother, Herman. Mr. Carl, as his employees knew him, started the company as a brick company. The company would purchase the ballasts out of ships at the Port of Houston. D'Hanis Brick and Tile was the company's first supplier and continues as a supplier today. In 1926, The Port of Houston ranked 11th in the nation in tonnage and began seeking foreign markets as sources of supply.

From 1924-1929 building permits in Houston climbed from $22,594,564 to more than $40,000,000.

After World War II, Houston had an estimated shortage of almost 40,000 homes. The greatest building and construction era in the city's history was underway.

Today, The Detering Company is owned and run by Carl Detering, Jr. His daughter, Cassie and son, Carlos are also working in the company, making this a third generation company. Throughout our many years serving Houston, The Detering Company has remained a family-owned and operated business, which allows for responsive management that can expeditiously make decisions on site.

We are proud to say that we are a supplier with a solid financial foundation. For more than eight decades, The Detering Company has remained dedicated to sound business practices and to only making promises that we can keep. We continue to uphold a reputation for getting our customers'​ orders correct and delivered on schedule.
name: The Detering Company

description:
Over 100 years of history to become a reference company worldwide.

Roca began its activity as a company that made cast iron radiators for domestic heating at its factory in Gavà, near Barcelona. After these first radiators, the firm expanded its portfolio with the production of boilers. In 1929, Roca entered the bathroom space by starting the production of baths.

Always attentive to the changes in society related to water culture, the main natural resource Roca works with, the company assumed in 1936 the challenge of producing vitreous china bathroom appliances. After that, in 1954 Roca started the production of brassware.

In the 90s the Group developed a first step of international expansion, mainly based on setting up commercial branches and signing agreements with local leading brands. Besides Portugal and France, Roca’s presence started to spread over the United Kingdom, Germany, Italy, Russia, Morocco, Argentina, Brazil and China.

The turning point of the internationalization process took place in 1999, with the acquisition of the Swiss Keramik Holding Laufen, fourth global manufacturer in those days. The acquisition of Laufen allowed the Group to strengthen its position in strategic markets where the brand had less presence, such as Eastern Europe, Brazil and the USA.

In 2005 Roca announces an ambitious strategic plan focused on bathroom spaces, achieving the world leadership of the sector in 2006.

Today, Roca is a global brand with presence in more than 170 markets, supplied by its 78 production plants and over 22.600 employees worldwide.

Roca Tile USA is an offspring of the Roca Corporation. It is a worldwide leader in manufacturing, distributing and marketing of high-quality ceramic and porcelain tile under two brands Roca and United States Ceramic Tile. The company’s product range offers solutions for multiple uses, from versatile wall tile to highly resistant indoor and outdoor floor tiles, including single colors, marble, wood, concrete, fabric, decorative tiles and a wide array of complementary pieces.
name: Roca USA

description:
95% of purchasing decisions are made subconsciously. How do you make sure you’re on the right side of that purchase decision?

What if there was a way for you to get inside the minds of consumers, so you can better understand their purchase drivers?

At D-TAG Analytics, our Deep Nuance Platform uses the power of AI-driven social intelligence to provide live, relevant, and thorough insights to help decision makers improve ROI on their marketing and sales efforts.

▸ Discover emerging trends and topics
▸ Analyze millions of conversations in 30+ different languages
▸ Identify fact and feeling-based drivers behind consumer decisions
▸ Gain deep, nuanced insights from more than 200 million sources (social media, news, blogs, forums, websites, and more)
▸ Know the emotions, needs, and perspectives of your customers

There is an extensive amount of data out there, but most SMA tools do not allow for deep analysis to truly help you make the best decisions for your business. That’s why we’ve created a highly tailored software that identifies accurate and professionally filtered data sources, so you’re only viewing the data that is relevant to your decision making.

With D-TAG, you’ll be able to answer the questions:
▸ How is our Brand perceived?
▸ What do consumers think about our products?
▸ Why are they choosing our competitors’ products?
▸ What are the decision points in their purchase journey?
▸ How effective was the Social Media Campaign we conducted, and how can we improve it to reach more clients?

We're a SaaS provider offering subscriptions to our platform and dashboard licenses, as well as a dedicated professional service team of experienced data scientists and analysts to support your business.

Our mission is to empower you to transform online conversations into real business value. No longer will you feel like you’re wasting time in the market research phase.

Let the future of market research guide you.

Get started today at www.d-tag.com
name: D-TAG Analytics

description:
L’azienda negli anni ha subito diverse trasformazioni fino alla recente acquisizione del comparto produttivo della Caffè Domenico Gioia S.r.l. da parte della Labcaffè S.r.l., azienda dello stesso gruppo creata nel 2002 con lo scopo di riorganizzare la distribuzione dell’azienda madre che opera con successo nel settore dal 1949. L’ esigenza in materia di qualità del prodotto fanno si che Labcaffè privilegi la produzione in stabilimenti propri, situati in Campania, ove da sempre è fortemente radicata la cultura del caffè di elevata qualità che oggi risulta premiante sul mercato; a guisa di ciò l’azienda ha investito in impianti tecnologicamente avanzati, dotati di un sistema che esegue la tostatura ecologica del caffè crudo che consente di tostare uniformemente i chicchi dal cuore all’esterno, ricavando così in tazza una bevanda più dolce e più aromatica. La tostatura ecologica del caffè, avviene mediante flussi direzionati di aria calda pulita che preriscaldano il caffè verde per evitare che subisca shock termici al momento della tostatura, e in totale assenza di fumi di combustione, contrariamente a quanto avviene nelle macchine tastatrici tradizionali. I prodotti si collocano nel segmento medio-alto, grazie, alla selezione e al sapiente dosaggio nelle miscele dei più pregiati caffè e alla meticolosità e la cura artigianale delle lavorazioni.
Certificazioni: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point Program, Gosstandardt, certificazioni di prodotto Biologico e Fairtrade, gestione della qualità certificato UNI EN ISO 9001:2008.
name: Caffè Gioia - Labcaffè

description:
Fruttella was founded in 1975, established mainly to cultivate and produce Egyptian fresh agricultural products earmarked for exportation to international markets. Our farms are located in Qalyubeia, the heart of the richest citrus producing geographical region in Egypt, which is about 50 Km away from Cairo, and includes approximately 30,000 acres specific to highest grade citrus cultivation. 

Superior Quality is our main focus and it is our best quality that enables us to enter rigorously in international markets. The Company's foundation, vision, mission and operational strategy is built upon the Company's shareholders and senior management commitment to building in-house expertise in the agricultural quality assurance field. Our farms are grown and cultivated according to international quality standards and our farms include a fully equipped packing house.

Our state-of-art citrus packing house was established in 2004, with a total production capacity of more than 45,000 tons per season following international quality and grading standards. Our Plant also contains a pre-cooling and cold storage facilities with a capacity of 4,000 tons.

Our vision is centred at becoming a global market player in the fresh agricultural export market, such a global positioning would be made possible by meeting and maintaining substantial and sustainable quality standards as well as certifications translated into operational action and efficient production processes.
name: Fruttella For Food Industry S.A.E.

description:
The ProMinent Group is a manufacturer of components and systems for metering as well as a reliable solution partner for water treatment.

ProMinent offers practical solutions for various industries through innovative products, a distinctive and long-term understanding of processes and strong application orientation. With this, ProMinent supports its customers worldwide in terms of safety, efficiency and environmental protection.

The Group is headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany. More than 2,700 employees in about 50 own sales and service companies as well as 11 production sites work hard to provide individual solutions and high-quality services to ProMinent customers in about 100 countries.

The ProMinent Group provides solutions for metering, water treatment and disinfection, measuring and control as well as digital fluid management for the following industries:

Chemical industry, industrial and municipal water treatment, food and beverage industry, treatment of swimming pool water, oil and gas industry and process industry.

The extensive product portfolio consists of metering pumps, peristaltic pumps, measuring and control technology and sensors to manage and meter fluids as well as metering systems for water treatment. For this purpose ProMinent provides all common systems, such as chlorine dioxide plants, chlorine gas metering systems, electrolysis systems, UV systems, ozone systems as well as systems for membrane filtration.

In order to be a long-term partner for its customers, the Group is investing constantly both in product innovations as well as in state-of-the-art manufacturing processes and a high level in-house production. 11 worldwide production facilities consistently guarantee high quality, flexibility and delivery reliability.

Privacy Policy
https://www.prominent.com/en/Footer/Privacy-Policy/Privacy-Policy.html
name: ProMinent Group

description:
Döhler is a global producer, marketer and provider of technology-driven natural ingredients, ingredient systems and integrated solutions for the global food, beverage and nutrition industry. Döhler’s ingredients are derived from natural raw materials. The comprehensive product portfolio of natural ingredients ranges from natural flavours, natural colours, natural health ingredients, a broad range of plant-based ingredients to ingredient systems and end-to-end solutions. 

With more than 45 production sites, 75 offices and application centres, Döhler creates value for customers in over 160 countries. description:
The Frigel group is made up of Italian and foreign companies whose purpose is the design, production, installation, sales and service of systems & solutions for process cooling and temperature control used to control temperatures of industrial processes.

Frigel products and solutions are designed to fit specific cooling and temperature control requirements of several industries, such as Plastic & Rubber, Food & Beverage, Power Generation & Transmission, Data Centers, Chemical & Pharma, Metals, and others.
Frigel has matured in-depth knowledge of thermodynamic requirements in these industrial processes, allowing it to design “application-tailored” equipment and systems, to suit the peculiarities and needs of each specific application.
Four key factors are driving the design of optimal solutions for each Customer, namely productivity, efficiency, sustainability and reliability.

Frigel Purpose is that of “Engineering a more efficient and sustainable industry”

Frigel Vision is to “Be a global innovator of high performance, sustainable and quality engineered solutions for process cooling and temperature control technologies”.

The Frigel group includes several manufacturing as well as sales, engineering and service sites in four continents:

Frigel Firenze S.p.A., (Florence - Italy) - headquarter, manufacturing, engineering, sales and service
Frigel Firenze S.p.A., (Padua - Italy) - manufacturing
Frigel GmbH (Germany) - engineering, sales and service
Frigel Eastern Europe Sp. z o.o. (Poland) - engineering, sales and service
Frigel North America Inc., (U.S.A.) - engineering, sales and service
Frigel Asia Pacific Ltd, (Thailand) - manufacturing, engineering, sales and service
Frigel Latino America Ltda, (Brazil) - engineering, sales and service
Frigel Intelligent Cooling Systems Pvt Ltd (India) - manufacturing, engineering, sales and service.

Furthermore, Frigel operates through a worldwide network of agents and distributors.
name: Frigel Group

description:
Cargill is a family company committed to providing food, ingredients, agricultural solutions, and industrial products to nourish the world in a safe, responsible, and sustainable way. We sit at the heart of the supply chain, partnering with producers and customers to source, make and deliver products that are vital for living.  

We provide customers with life’s essentials to enable businesses to grow, communities to prosper and consumers to live well in their daily lives.  With sustainability embedded in our purpose, it’s part of everything we do. 

We listen and we care, so we can anticipate and meet our customers’ needs in an ever-changing world. Ours is a long-term view, harnessing over 158 years of experience to look ahead while remaining true to the values that have guided us from the start. We put people first. We reach higher. We do the right thing—today and for generations to come.
name: Cargill

description:
Prodalim Group provides optimized solutions to bottling companies across the globe. More simply put, we do all of the hard work to get top-quality fruit juices into the hands of bottling companies, who then make sure that those same juices fill your glass. 

To make this happen, we start by understanding the specific needs of our customers. We proceed to carefully research the flavors consumers will like the most, meticulously choose top quality growers from whom to buy fruit, figure out the best, and most eco-friendly way to press, blend and store the juices we produce, and finally, how to effectively and efficiently transport our products to our customers, premium bottlers across the world.

What’s our Secret?
We hold as our operational cornerstones 4 central principles that are the basis for our market beating results:  
Innovation
Integrity and Reliability
Quality
Partnership and Fairness

These values come to bear in the 360° solutions we offer to our customers including product research and development, sourcing of raw materials, manufacturing, blending, compounds,  storing, and distribution. From our various offices and distribution centers; NL, Spain, Italy, Brazil and China, using a network of growers in 35 countries, we’ve constructed a wide portfolio of raw material related to the juice and citrus oils industry product offerings and organized multiple distribution centers, allowing us to be substantially more responsive and competitive to our customers. 

Our 350customers in over 50 countries, including some of the world’s top, blue-chip bottlers are well aware of this commitment to excellence and to them. description:
A FRIEND'S PHILOSOPHY
Here at Vermont Coffee Company we try hard to be a good friend—locally and globally. Our motto, “Coffee Roasted for Friends®,” is more than a slogan, it’s really our mission, our reason for being in this business. Coffee is a social stimulus that brings people together to share ideas and stories, and when people come together, a community is formed and friends are made. 

We’re a small-town roaster located in Middlebury, Vermont. The big flavor and complex character of our coffees are highlights of our unique style of slow-roasting our beans in small batches—a process that founder Paul Ralston has perfected since the company began roasting commercially in 2000. As of April 2018 we're roasting all of our coffee using 100% renewable energy.

ABOUT OUR COFFEE
All of our beans are 100% certified organic. We source them from the great coffee-growing regions around the world, seeking out big flavor and bold character in the beans we choose.

We've developed a unique style of slow-roasting our coffee in small batches, which caramelizes the beans and brings out the semi-sweet, chocolate flavor.

WHERE TO FIND OUR COFFEE
Our coffee is sold in chain grocery stores, local markets and food co-ops throughout the Northeast including Hannaford's, Market Basket, Shaw's and Costco. Products are sold nationally via the company's online store. Our visit us in person at the Vermont Coffee Company CAFE.
name: Vermont Coffee Company
